b"b' Commit will prevent invalid Aspect Ratio value writes to xbmc movie info...'"

b'b\' ... database The genesis for the problem addressed in this commit is the bluray spec.  Itincludes the black bars of a scope movie in the blu ray disc movie files.When a user creates a 1:1 unencoded rip of a bluray disc to use with xbmc the video filealso has the black bars.  The algorithm used to calculate the Aspect Ratio by the default video player in xbmcuses the entire video file
column11: black bars with the movie content
column12: thus causing all scope movies (2.35
column14: etc..)to have a 1.778 calculated Aspect Ratio value.  This incorrect value is written to xbmc\\\'smovie information database
column15: overwriting any valid scope Aspect Ratio already there from a  file.To be clear this issue does not effect how a movie is displayed
column16: only what is displayed in themovie information areas of xbmc during and after playback.  It goes without saying thecode used to fix this problem is not the optimum way to address the problem
column17: it is a temporaryfix to be used until a developer familiar with the code used to calculate the Aspect Ratioin xbmc player is able to modify it to become "black bar aware".  One suggestion was to check ifthe code used to crop black bars in xbmc can be re-used to make the Aspect Ratio algorithm"black bar aware". The  request addressed in this patch to  is described inthese xbmc forum threads: url url  I created the first thread to discuss possible solutions
column18: track progress of mods done inxbmc-12.0 source code
column19: and highlight difficulties in porting the working solution in xbmc-12.0to xbmc-13.0.  Significant progress was recently made in porting the fix to xbmc-13.0
column20: this commitwas created for the xbmc master branch developers to review for inclusion to the xbmc-13.0 source code. Below is a cut from comment lines added to  describing the source code changes: File has been modified to prevent overwrites of valid Aspect Ratios taken from nfo fileswhen available.  To activate the new code it requires user intervention to create a flag file
column21: typically donefrom a simple xbmc python add-on
column22: but can be done manually if the user creates the file.When the  is removed
column23: either by the python add-on script
column24: or manual deletion by a userthe original code is used. The code changes consisted of adding a function
column26: to parse the Aspect ratiofrom the nfo file
column27: adding lines to define the active movie path within the function CGUIInfoManager::GetItemLabel
column28: and lines added to two case statements VIDEOPLAYER_VIDEO_ASPECT
column29: to write the Aspect Ratio of the nfo fileto the database so it is displayed correctly in the information menus within video player during playbackand LISTITEM_VIDEO_ASPECT to write the Aspect Ratio of the nfo file to the info database so it is persistent after stopping playback.  is the patch file for  to implement the  fix. One additonal note.  Skins for xmbc need to be modified to include png files that will display the correct icon for scopemovies (2.35
column31: etc..).  It looks like the user ronnie\\\'s pull request 3182  to include the icons in the defaultconfluence skin
column32: and common Aspect Ratios in was merged into the branch in 08 2013.\''

column10: b'b" Before we get to the cosmetics
column11: this is completely unacceptable as it reads a file off the filesystem every single frame (potentially multiple times per frame). The better solution here is to ensure that
column12: during file playback
column13: we don\'t alter streamdetails if the item already has it set.  This may be non-trivial
column14: I\'m not sure.  The problem is that I\'m sure there\'s occasions where we would want to update streamdetails
column15: and determining these may be non-trivial? @Montellese: Any ideas on that?"'

column10: b'b" We were discussing this the other night.  Apparently it\'s a common practice to replace a video on the FS with a higher quality one and keep the file name and path identical.  People are weird
column11: right?  Anyway
column12: this one should be pretty easy to grab comparing file sizes. I\'ve also seen some cases where not all of the attributes get filled out at scan time
column13: but after playback the remainder get filled in.  For these
column14: perhaps we could keep a bit field and mark it when each attribute gets set.  Then overwrite if the bit fields don\'t match the db when playback stops.  Of course we\'ll have to actually encapsulate a class for this to work
column15: which has historically been taboo. ;)"'

column11: not overwriting streamdetails on each playback would also ease up things for stereoscopics handling (this + having a possibility to  the streamdetails without hacking the db directly)'"

column10: b'b" Based on jmarshallnz\'s comment went back and looked at how to keep valid Aspect Ratio info after playback by stopping the writes to streamdetails.  Added trivial code to the function UpdateFileState in  to check the item for any of the 10 current Aspect Ratios defined in
column11: using a logic block with statements for each valid Aspect Ratio
column12: if any are found in item the write to streamdetails is bypassed.  When no valid Aspect Ratio is  found the current code is run to write the streamdetails with what the player .  To get the player info bar to display valid Aspect Ratio info already in item
column13: added the same logic block to the VIDEOPLAYER_VIDEO_ASPECT case statement in . No other code change is required
column14: and using this approach eliminates the thousands(millions??) of file system reads from the original attempt in this commit.  The logic statements could be moved to a new function that is called in both  and
column15: and returns a boolean value that is used to accomplish the same thing. It might make things cleaner if large chunks of more advanced code needs  to be added to check for all the  oddball cases like the one t-nelson mentioned that still require updating streamdetails.  If it was determined other streamdetails
column16: like the AudioCodec are not calculated correctly
column17: we could do the same process in the VIDEOPLAYER_AUDIO_CODEC case statement
column18: to have it displayed correctly in the videoplayer info tab.  Using a function call might even be more attractive to prevent multiple duplications of similar code lines. If this approach sounds reasonable

b'b\' I\\\'m tempted to reject as I\\\'m not sure that the idea of a "global" menu button has been thought through enough.  As I said earlier
column11: we now have 3 "Menu" usages: ContextMenu
column12: controls
column13: This new button. Previously with just the Context menu and  controls you could use a single button to map it (theoretically) as if you were on a list you\\\'d do context
column14: and if not you\\\'d throw up PlayerControls. (This wasn\\\'t actually possible
column15: but could have been implemented without compromising things on a single button
column16: though it does rely on being able to navigate out of a list). This changes it so that you need 2 buttons while on a list: One for context
column17: and one to "jump out to the on-screen menu".  Further
column18: the "on screen menu" action is literally limited to "jump to a control" the skinner can\\\'t do anything else with it. While this might be a UI improvement
column19: I\\\'m not sure that it is sufficiently general.  Further
column20: there\\\'s a danger that skins come to rely on this additional "jump" being available thus making the dual menu system engrained
column21: meaning that some simpler remotes may be left without key actions. Is the UI improvement enough to overcome these problems
column22: or is it a case of being better to leave it out of Gotham and work on unifying things a bit for Gotham+1 ?\''

column12: so in that respect is by design. There\'s basically 2 things at work:1.  Which window context to use to map from input -2.  Which window to send the action to. By changing the iWindow you change number 1 i.e. when the video OSD is up
column13: you don\'t read the actions in the fullscreen section of keymap. By changing number 2
column14: the action is sent to the dialog
column15: rather than the window. There\'s fallbacks in place for one specific window in the code: The fullscreen info dialog (in Confluence
column16: it looks like the OSD without the  buttons bring it up via I on keyboard or INFO on remote). The code in OnKey handles getting the correct context for number 1 above.  The code in GUIWindowManager::OnAction handles re-routing the action to the fullscreen window if the dialog doesn\'t handle it."'

column10: b"b' Suspend via logind over UPower if available.'"
b"b' The suspend feature of UPower is deprecated. XBMC supports suspending using systemd-logind
column11: however it defaults to a few other UPower methods first before trying Logind. This patch checks for logind first
column12: and uses it if available.'"

column10: b'b" @Anyone the UPower suspend methods will be removed from distros pretty soon. Logind should be the default choice for suspending on Linux when it exists. If the default order isn\'t changed
column11: there should be a way to configure and force XBMC to use logind for suspend."'

column10: b"b' @yasij: thanks for doing that PR. The dev in charge @topfs2 will be available next week again to review.'"
b"b' @topfs2 I think I saw you active on the forums this morning.  Any comments?'"

b'b" I haven\'t really kept myself up to date if logind is superseeding upower and such but the patch looks correct if thats true.The one thing which strikes me is that isn\'t it possible to have logind without suspend capabilities but upower with? Have a small recollection that one ubuntu (latest?) behaved like that?"'
b'b" Ubuntu supports suspend with logind. It uses upstart for init instead of systemd
column11: and implements the part it needs through some extra scripts in the systemd-shim package. The problem is that UPower suspend can act weird in this case because the shim doesn\'t properly signal UPower on wakeup when UPower is used to suspend. Actually
column12: I think Debian with sysvinit does not have the shim scripts implemented
column13: and thus suspend wouldn\'t work. It also won\'t work with systemd-logind versions before 183 because  was added in that version. Maybe the suspend method should be configurable?"'

column10: b'b" The way KDE checks for it is here: url  It checks the systemd version
column11: and if the version API isn\'t implemented
column12: it checks for upstart."'

column10: b'b" What\'s the potential for this affecting older distros?  I\'m more concerned about breaking people\'s current installs than new ones
column11: for Gotham."'

column10: b'b" The potential is certainly there for affecting older distros that are using systemd with logind before  support was added. It looks like Fedora 17 and OpenSUSE 12.2 use systemd version 44 which doesn\'t support suspend. Ubuntu added systemd-logind in raring 13.04 and has the shim scripts for suspend. Before that
column11: Ubuntu didn\'t have any piece of systemd
column12: so the check for logind will fail. There is a CanSuspend() method in the logind dbus API (as well as CanPowerOff()
column13: CanReboot()
column14: CanHibernate()
column15: CanHybridSleep()). These might need to be checked with a transition over to the UPower method if they return no."'

b'b" We aren\'t testing his git fu. We\'re keeping our history clean.  It makesfuture bisecting and reverting much easier. You never need a GUI to do something with git.  Use git reflog to find thetime the tip was moved before the offending rebase. Do a hard reset to thatpoint (eg. git reset hard HEAD@{4}).  Then try again."'

b"b' Audio dsp addon handling'"

b"b' Attached a audio DSP processing system over add-ons. This is my first version and not complete finished. Can you have a look over it and any ideas for things which must be improved or are wrong. The current system in steps:Data is passed from CActiveAEBufferPoolResample to the DSP processing system if DSP enabled and minimum one add-on is available.All Add-ons are asked about the requested stream type to find available addons and modes
column11: e.g. 5.1 Audio not need a stereo up mix.The system makes a list of master processing modes which are selectable from user.The system makes also a list of pre and post processing modes which are selectable and process point moveable inside Settings->System->Audio->Audio DSP SettingsOn data processing it goes over following steps:  1. Input processing Unmodified input stream and is send to all enabled add-ons for detection and error correction  2. Input re-sample Re sample of the input signal for the master processing
column12: only one add-on is allowed for it.  3. Pre processing Used for any steps before master processing. All enabled add-ons functions are called to make this.  4. Master processing The main processing like
column13: surround up mix or sound modification processes. Only one from user over menu selectable mode is allowed. Add-ons can pass multiple selectable modes to KODI. If input channel alignment on it is higher as requested output and the master mode does not perform a down mix it becomes handled from ffmpeg re sample after return of master function.  5. Post processing Used for any other steps like
column14: volume correction
column15: equalizer and much more. All enabled add-ons functions are called to make this.  6. Output re-sample Re sampling of the processing signal to KODI audio output processing. The pre and post processing modes can be selected and moved within processing chain on audio dsp settings inside Settings->System->Audio. Things to do or finished:The first version of dsp add-on headers and the basic system is finished.Things for me which missing and are to-do:  1. Code cleanup  2. Faults removal  3. Create a helper documentation about a DSP add-on programming  4. Code re check Addon position![audiodsp1]url The DSP enable position![audiodsp addon setting6]url The button position to select streaming DSP settings dialogue![audiodsp addon setting4]url The basic settings dialogue
column16: separated in sub menus![audiodsp addon setting5]url A add-on master mode settings dialogue![audiodsp addon setting]url Process chain information dialog (with CPU usage)![audiodsp addon setting2]url Add-on mode process chain selection dialogue![audiodsp addon setting3]url '"

column12: the comments on those commits should persist. If you squashed something

b'b" [osxsink] don\'t iterate through all buffers in the CA rendercallback but only fill our stream idx"'

b'b" This reverts commit b9a1d07a7d1a2bec3bb094b97cc7d96a325b9b98. I think this is needed for working nicely with some studio equipment (like fireface). As mentioned here by a fireface user he gets speed up sound with hickups comeing out of more output channels then configured: url  My guess is that this card (it has 18 or more audio outputs) has split its channels into multiple  so we are now feeding our data into those buffers and the for loop spreads our data throughout all channels of that card. This leads to the  the user describes because our data is ment to be fed into a 2.0 channel buffer for example instead of 6 2.0 channel buffers for example. Unfortunatly i can\'t get a hand on that user anymore but i think what we do now is just dangerous. @jmarshallnz i think i found one with more then 1 buffer ;)"'
b"b' @jmarshallnz your button. jenkins build this please'"
b'b" If it\'s verified by the user
column11: fine.  If not
column12: IMO we shouldn\'t be altering code based on assumptions."'

column10: b'b" Vlc has it that way we had it that way with Old  there is no reason to invent the Code we have now out of nowhere it doesn\'t make Sense to iterate over the Buffers eating away our Packets but sure i am trying to get that user to respond... "'
b'b" I\'m not sure which way is the assumption but the old way was working fine for years and was originally added by an expert in osx core audio. "'

b'b" I think we can be reasonably confident that the expert in osx core audio wasn\'t all that confident with their decision: I think we can also be reasonably confident that VLC isn\'t sure either they use only buffer 0 in their analog renderer
column11: while using a stream index in their SPDIF renderer.  The stream index was introduced when their SPDIF renderer was introduced (and hasn\'t changed since 2005)
column12: so I wouldn\'t be confident of that being correct either
column13: particularly as I suspect the stream index is always 0... As far as I can tell
column14: the difference is in how planar and interleaved output are handled.  i.e. in planar audio the number of buffers is equal to the number of channels
column15: whereas in interleaved you get a single buffer.  Various CA code out there (e.g. chromium and others) determine interleaved versus planar based on the number of buffers the device signals.  We don\'t do that
column16: but I\'m guessing that we probably should
column17: and that this may be the error that is being made on the more exotic HW that isn\'t working.  If this is the case
column18: then adopting this change isn\'t the solution I don\'t think. Either way
column19: it pays not to guess :) Get the hardware or a user with the hardware to reproduce the fault
column20: with additional debugging info if possible
column21: so we can figure out what actually goes on."'

b'b\' Last fact the PR how it is now (just reverting to the stream idx instead of looping over the buffers) sort off makes audio usable for the fireface user (he then gets stereo audio which just comes out on channels 8 and 9 instead of expected channels 1 and 2). Also @herrnst signaled that this change made his sblive (or what it was) kinda work. It has a flawed driver so that it announces multiple streams with each only having "1 channel". With the former code his audio was just garbled. Witht this PR he at least gets the (sort off expected by the streams which are announced by the driver) mono output. I don\\\'t wanna argue really but once again it doesn\\\'t look like those buffers have anything to do with interleaved or planar audio. Or it seems drivers are free to do whatever they want with those buffers ;). Last thing the streamidx for the fireface user is 1 (hardcoded 0 brings hell into audio for him again). So yes the assumption that each stream MIGHT have its own buffer index is correct imo.\''

b"b' some formats like WMA lossless are not seekable.  need be to informed 1dca25f fixes incorrect state of eof. imo it makes no sense setting the stream eof right after open. ffmpeg demuxer is able able to detect a seek error in this case.'"
b"b' jenkins build this please'"
b"b' typo in comment is corrected'"
b"b' Are you happy the Seek is always a cheap operation? Any reason for seeking to 10? I believe some codecs have a lot of frames per second  (e.g. TrueHD @ 48kHz has 1200 frames per second)
column11: so if that were non-seekable
column12: then the Seek(10) might read 12 frames before returning.Would Seek(1) not work as well?'"

column10: b"b' I was tempted to write Seek(1) but feared this could be rounded to 0.If the stream is not seekable it should return immediately with error. do you mean it is expensive for a seekable stream which has no index and seek is slow? '"
b'b" Yes
column11: I\'m thinking about the non-indexed case where seeking needs to read all frames up to the given time.Why do you fear Seek(1) would be rounded to 0
column12: but not that Seek(10) will be rounded to 0?Unless something in code suggest the latter is safe and the former is unsafe then it seems likely that both are safe (most likely) or both are unsafe."'

column10: b"b' Language addons'"

b'b\' Last weekend I was thining that it would be nice if we would support addons that simply provide files that could be used by internal code  by other addons. There would be no logic and nothing to be executed in those addons. An example use case would be image package addons that could be used by multiple skins (e.g. an image package of all studio logos). I started working on it and added a basic "resource" addon which is exposed through our VFS under a  path. Since I don\\\'t know much about skinning I decided to try another possible resource addon and came up with language addons. Every language in Kodi basically consists of a and a so there are only files and no other logic. So I came up with the addon extension point and addons. The files of a language are available through  . I have adjusted the startup code (had to move addon initialization before language loading) and added some logic to handle updates coming from old configurations. I have also added reloading of language strings if the addon providing the currently used language is updated. Furthermore I have added a dialog asking the user if he wants to switch to a newly installed language (same as for skins). I have converted all existing languages to addons but I\\\'m pretty sure that I messed some of them up. Furthermore I noticed that not all of the languages with a  have a . How does that work? Last but not least the language also had a file which doesn\\\'t seem to be  anywhere in our code base so I removed it. I have also tried to adjust the build scripts but that\\\'s completely untested right now. On win32 it\\\'s also not possible right now to choose the installed languages in the installation wizard. Furthermore Xcode will need updating. I have no idea how this fits into the tools used by @alanwww1 and our transifex project. Maybe with this it could become possible for language-specific teams to create an updated addon of their language themselves and submit them to the official repository to lessen the work @alanwww1 has to do on his own right now. TODOs:[x] we need to upload all addons to a repository and integrate it into our addon repository[x] I don\\\'t like having hardcoded[x] refreshing of the main addon repository doesn\\\'t work if the login dialog is enabled due to url [ ] the OK dialog letting the user know that we had to fall back to the English language because we couldn\\\'t find the configured language doesn\\\'t always show because Confluence\\\'s replaces the startup window with the home window which leads to the dialog being hidden. Whether the dialog is visible or not depends on timing. The same problem applies to the migration info dialog that @Memphiz added for the XBMC -[ ] we need to figure out if the windows installer properly deletes the old directory[x] android packaging still seems to include the old language files\''

column10: b'b" Yeah I\'ve considered addon language packs as a possibility for the future as well. But IMO there\'s a difference there because it wouldn\'t really make sense to list them as usual addons. They should have a special integration that would show them either on the addon info dialog or in the addon settings dialog of a specific addon. But from a usage point of view they could work the same by exposing them through a path. One thing that might get tricky is to  a specific language addon of every installed addon when the user changes the language in Kodi. So if he switches from English to German we also need to download all the german language addons for every installed addon automatically. But for now I\'d like to keep it simple and see if anyone objects to the idea of resource and language addons. PS: And yes documenting the startup sequence (with potential dependencies) would be a good idea. There are things that must happen after other things and cannot just be moved around."'

column12: and XML elements from to  . So the only information left in are the regions. That should make it easier to move them into separate addons as well. I also stumbled over a small bug concerning sorttokens (which should be solved now). The list of sorttokens will be expanded every time the user changes the language setting so if you move from English to French and back to English the sorttoken list will containThe (from the English language)The (also defined as a sort token in our French language)LeLaLesUnUneDesThe (from the English language) In this case it\'s not that bad but if you switch to a language with completely different tokens it might screw up your sorting."'

What I meant, is we do have a few more addons in kodi master, which does not have any other upstream repo. For example, skin confluence, visualizations and other stuff. In this step I can do the whole rebranding stuff as well. Still I have some thoughts in my mind:The whole  file format this way is strange, because we will have an xx_YY format locale set for language and we will have a completely separate YY format code for region code. So for example I can choose de_DE for language, but under it will be selectable Austria as a region code. I think it will look strange, because normally this should be defined by the locale _YY part.The visible language is also not in line with the new codes at the moment. So when you select German, you will select de_DE instead. This is problematic when a Translator wants to sign up and tries to find the right language for him. maybe would be good to change the language names over as well.  @Montellese wrote that he is planning to remove theese  files completely, but how would we handle combinations like  that way ? I mean there is no language team like that currently. Maybe we could define fallback languages in the  language addon that it will pull in the de_DE and invisibly for the user, using that instead the English. But still this will result a lot more language addons that we have now in this PR.For both the above two problems it would be a solution that selecting the language name in GUI (German) and selecting the region (eg. Austria) will automatically choose the right and available language pack and the legacy language name to use with older addons. This is far the most simple solution from user perspective. What is your opinion guys ?For updating the  file I will need some kind of Version or API bump or something that can be read with my sync utility to separate the two systems. So solution suggestion I.Change this PR slightly to make Kodi able to actually use the region set in the GUI and choose the right language pack with the xx_YY locale format.Keep only the region specific info in  Solution suggestion II.Make additional "dummy" language packs with all the existing  combination with reference to fallback language addons.Delete  files. I think in GUI we should only show the language name when choosing a language and changing region would give us the complete locale. This means we have to strip down current "language" names like "English (US)" to simply "English". Not so much we have from this type.\''

b'b\' With #6549 it might be possible to directly move to only only shipping Kodi with the english language addon. It would require a few adjustments like downloading the currently selected language addon during startup if it isn\\\'t installed but available for installation and adjusting the language selection to show all languages all the time (without the additional "Get more..." step). But that would save us from having to mess around with disabling all unused language addons etc.\''

b'b\' OK I\\\'ve taken a stab at combining this with #6549 to see how the "only  the English language addon by default" could work out. What I did isremove all addons except  update setting definition to list all  language addonsadded startup logic that looks for an installable language addon that matches the old language name and installs it There are a few (minor) issuesI had to hack the extension point names back to because the language addons that @MartijnKaijser uploaded to our addon repo for testing still use thoseall this logic is executed before we even show the splash screen and depending on the internet connection can take several secondsit only works if the user has a working internet connectionI had to hardcode to be flushed and refreshed. We could simply  all repositories but that would take even longerIt probably doesn\\\'t work yet with multiple profiles as the logic is only executed during initial startup and not when  profiles\''

b'b\' Guess we also need to wait till network is up for this to work properly (which is needed in general for other code parts).Maybe throw popup that he needs a working connection when no internet connection is available and user wants to  a not-yet installed language. Doing this would make it more user friendly than only showing "English (UK)" and nothing else if repo failed to load. What happens when you switch to several languages? Will those remain installed or do you clean up? Not that is really matters i think. Just a thought. will update the repo add-ons.\''

b'b" I don\'t know why we have to load the language files at that point in the startup process but simply doing the  logic will be tricky but I\'ll look into it. I don\'t clean up any language addons. IMO if the user installs one manually we shouldn\'t delete it automatically. And I doubt that  will switch between more than 2 or 3 languages tops."'

b'b" Language should be loaded just in front of loading skin(s). Don\'t know when they are loaded now. So would you force refresh the repo one time or on each start (because you mentioned hardflush repo)? Doing this would possible also solve some issues with skins not directly updating to the newer version for that release. It would benefit more add-ons as well doing a force repo update on first release . I think a delayed gui loading (like we already do for db upgrade) to process initial update for fetching  and others would be preferred. Sorry for bit off topic on this one and i suspect that would be a separate PR. edit:repo refetch is currently once in 24hours. So if you started version X and then upgraded to version Y you will get a delayed repo update of ~24hours"'

b'b\' Right now it\\\'s only force refreshed if the current value of can\\\'t be found and can\\\'t be matched to an installed language addon. Doing it every time is not a good idea IMO. I agree that it would be nice to have a "this is the first time this release has been started" flag to do some update specific stuff (like refreshing all addon repositories). But in that case we should figure out a way to display some information on the splash screen so that users know that something is going on and it\\\'s not frozen.\''
b'b" yep agreed. just mentioning it :)if language can\'t be downloaded at first run you auto fall back to English (UK)?"'

b"b' OK I looked some more into the startup logic and  languages. Moving the logic that loads languages right before loading the skin is possible which means that the user can at least see the splash screen while we are trying to find and install a matching language addon. But showing a modal dialog if we had to fallback to the default language (English) is gonna be very tricky. The problem is that confluence uses a which contains logic to replace the active window with the startup window. From what I can tell this is only there to support an optional startup playlist. This results in the modal dialog being replaced by the startup window immediately. Obviously showing a kai toast would be possible. On which platform are we showing a XBMC -'"

Is there any reason you choose to do it this way and removed it from ? I think the upgrade dialog shows on all platforms. Confluence uses the  but other skin might do it different."'

column13: locales etc because people couldn\'t decide what they wanted. I\'m not gonna do it again. If someone wants to do it and send me a PR I\'m ok with that. What\'s the rational behind storing the full in the repositories XML file anyway? Wouldn\'t it make sense to only transfer specific tags (with or without their children)? Furthermore there are addons with summaries and descriptions in all languages which take up waaaay more space. IMO having the repository backend system getting in the way of improving / simplifying the addon system is wrong and we need to do something about it."'

b'b" OK now that #6510 and #6549 have been merged I have rebased and adjusted this (again). I have extended the startup logic to determine the new language addon ID with logic to refresh the main addon repo to check for an installable addon in case there\'s no matching locally installed language addon. There are a few known issues and things that need to be considered:we need to upload all addons to a repository and integrate it into our addon repositoryI don\'t like having hardcoded in c5def2ee61bc1b4cd5be9fb6ebffab5c611e67e0refreshing of the main addon repository doesn\'t work if the login dialog is enabled due to url the OK dialog letting the user know that we had to fall back to the English language because we couldn\'t find the configured language doesn\'t always show because Confluence\'s replaces the startup window with the home window which leads to the dialog being hidden. Whether the dialog is visible or not depends on timing. The same problem applies to the migration info dialog that @Memphiz added for the XBMC -we need to figure out if the windows installer properly deletes the old directory"'

b'b\' @MartijnKaijser: you don\\\'t happen to have a debug log from that? I added log messages for all kinds of error cases in the startup logic. @tamland: IMO doing it after the login screen is bad user experience. If a user is running Helix and he has set Kodi to Chinese and then he updates to Isengard and he suddenly gets an English screen and he has no idea that it will change back to Chinese after logging in.I also don\\\'t think that this kind of update logic falls under the "auto update is turned off". It\\\'s not a normal addon update. Without it you leave users with a GUI language that they might not necessarily understand (yes most people understand a bit of English but not all do). Ideally when updating Kodi you shouldn\\\'t have to change something to get back to the state you had configured before the update. The user has already decided in Helix that he wants to see the GUI in language X so why would he not consent to the same thing in Isengard?\''
b'b\' just as an idea for a follow up change but would it be possible to detect the OS language and use this auto-update logic to install the "correct" user language automatically?\''
b'b" @Montellese I agree that it probably doesn\'t fall under normal addon update
column11: and that uses should have to configure again. But my point is about doing it without asking. Nowhere did it say when originally choosing a language that you signed up for auto . People won\'t like that you do that sort of thing silently."'

column10: b'b" Personally I\'m more concerned about the people not understanding the dialog that\'s thrown in their face in a langauge they don\'t necessarily understand. It\'s not always possible to please everyone and it also complicates the startup logic even more. If we want to do this after the login screen we have to duplicate logic again because we have to cover the case where there\'s no login screen and the case where there is (and they end up in completely different code locations)."'

b"b' I agree with @Montellese here. We are responsible for outsourcing the languages to add-ons and as such the user should not be bothered with our redesign and having to choose a language again or even confirming that this will happen. What dialog would you show? At the time of the dialog only English is installed and large part of the world has no idea what it says. If we can silently convert it from old shipped language to the add-on we should do so. Regardless of add-on update setting. This will happen one time in transition from 14.x to 15.x (or higher). After that it should follow update logic as normal add-ons. @da-anda Karlson2k was working on that but requires a lot of changes to properly detect it from the OS and then we still hit the font issues.'"

column10: b'b\' @MartijnKaijser Think that we should reopen this: url  plibc was a crazy "posix emulation" lib\''
b"b' [] add inapp update feature via sparkle framework / winsparkle'"

b'b\' Well feature time. This PR adds the  based inapp update feature to Kodi on osx. Most osx users know this updating system from various other apps. Its the quasi standard updater. This PR does:1. add sparkle framework building to our target depends (we build it from source no binaries right? ^^)2. adds all the needed stuff to the osx project This is how it looks like when an update is available: url url url url  The user can either manually "look" for updates via the menu or let sparkle do its magic. He also can decide to skip only one version of kodi or if he doesn\\\'t want to update now he can delay it. He even can activate an auto update feature without user interaction. If you wonder why there is a public key in those commits. For security reasons we have to sign the DMG so that the updater can verify that the update is really done by us (i would hook the signing up to the release jenkins job or the alpha job in case we want to provide alpha update via sparkle). Basically the signing is done because of the same reasons we have to sign the apk file for android. What do you think? (given the risk free integration we could even think about taking this into 14.2 once its in we can publish versions via an serverside xml). As you can see the updatexml which holds the metadata about available updates can be defined in  (in case we want to have different files for alpha and final releases). For now i just would put them to the osx downloads on the mirror. Once we release we just kick the jenkins job (which is not adapted yet) which signs the dmg the sign process results in an dsa key hash which has to be added to the xml file (this is manual work like when i update cydia repo). XML file structure is straight forward (title
column11: version
column12: size
column13: dsa hash
column14: ). Yeah long text. :) wanted?\''

column10: b"b' Awesome ;)'"

b'b\' We can configure every aspect of this updater. We could also for example disable auto update checks completely. We could aswell add a setting in our GUI which triggers a check for update. We could even completely use our GUI for all dialogs (because the API allows us to intercept all events like "update found"
column11:
changelogs received" "update progress" and so on. The latter is just a bit to much work for just trying it out. Well i think for the start i could just add a setting somewhere in Kodi which triggers a check for updates and either prints a dialog "no updates found" or the original native system dialogs for the update appear. The default is it checks once when starting the software and then once a day iirc.\''

column10: b'b" @Rechi @tamland  @afedchin  i updated this PR. 1. check interval is hardcoded to 1 week now (decided on devcon) 2. Init and deinit is moved from the main classes to the ServiceManager 3. Sparklefeed is in its own subfolder on the mirrors now and we aim for 4 different xml feed:  a. sparkleupdate_ (nightly builds we don\'t push updates to that file)  b. sparkleupdate_CODENAME_ (f.e. sparkleupdate_leia_) all alphas are pushed to that feed  c. same with beta instead of alpha  d. same with release instead of alpha  Selecting in which feed we push is done in the jenkins job (XML_PREFIX parameter).  We tested it during devcon on osx and windows once more  if you want to try here is a prepared build made from this PR: url  url We decided to merge this soonish before we branch to leia (and then after branching change feed url to _leia_ file for pushing alphas of leia via sparkle already).  Anything left in your opinion?"'

b"b' Specify download mirror for libs'"
b'b" This change improves project\\\\BuildDependencies\\\\ (and friends). Several times now
column11: I\'ve run into issues with the mirror selected from url  being broken. I\'m addressing this by adding support for a KODI_MIRROR environment variable; if set
column12: the download scripts will use that mirror rather than auto-picking one from url  If  hits a failure downloading something
column13: it will print out a message telling the user how to set KODI_MIRROR and try again. I\'ve also fixed a handful of other issues in the download scripts:1. They can now be run from directories other than project\\\\BuildDependencies. Now
column14: if you run  from the kodi root directory
column15: it will no longer delete the checked in files in kodi\\\\
column16: all paths are constructed relative to %~dp0 (the directory containing the script).2. get_ now reports a list of failed downloads at the end
column17: so if something failed
column18: you can see what it was.3. Fix a few places where errors were not handled
column19: or missing directories were not created."'

column10: b'b\' I have a git-related question: If you look at the commits associated with this pull request
column11: you\\\'ll see that I inadvertently incorporated a commit (daccd62) from another outstanding pull request (it was in my "master" branch
column12: so it was automatically incorporated into the "specify_download_mirror" branch when I created it). That didn\\\'t seem appropriate
column13: since it\\\'s an unrelated change
column14: so I did a "git revert" on that change in my topic branch. Now
column15: I\\\'m wondering if that was the right thing to  happens when both pull requests are merged into the main repo? Will my "revert" in this branch effectively cancel out the other pull request? If this is going to be a problem when both pull requests are merged
column16: can someone tell me how to fix this? I\\\'m kind of a git newbie. (Intuitively
column17: it seems like the solution might be to "rebase" this branch so that it no longer incorporates commit daccd62
column18: but I don\\\'t understand git well enough to understand all the implications of rewriting the repro history
column19: particularly since I\\\'ve already pushed the current version of the specify_download_mirror branch from my local repro into my github fork.\''

column10: b'b" No implications and no problems since your fork isn\'t being used by anyone else. Fastest way using shell: Your default editor will open. **Delete** the line referencing the commit you wish to throw away (daccd62).Save the file. git will drop back to the shell and rewrite history. will update your branch and this PR. More about rebase url  and how useful it is ;)"'
b"b' I like the idea. Sent you a PR that adds the same env var for all other platforms as well.'"

b"b' [RFC] Add multi source input '"
b'b" @FernetMenta Still a bit work to do
column11: therefore RFC. Please ignore the [Util] changes. **_Reading from demuxers:_** The available demuxers are organized via a min heap. The sorting criteria is the dts or pts of the last packet they had delivered. The top demuxer in that heap is selected for reading. **_Organizing the streams:_** Unfortunately this does not work out of the box because each demuxer d_i numbers its streams from 0 to n_i
column12: but the dvdplayer numbers them from 0 to sum_i(n_i). Hence the dvdplayer can\'t determine if the current packet should be forwarded to the  player (because of the stream id mismatch). There are two solutions I can think of.  First we could copy the streams and collected them in the multi source demuxer. This is less future-proof and less efficient imo.I have implemented that as a poc here: url  The second one is presented by this pr. The streams of the demuxers are renumbered so that the ids match the ids of the dvdplayer. Before I put more work into it
column13: which solution is preferable
column14: or is there an even better one?"'

column10: b"b' @FernetMenta description added.'"
b'b" nice work
column11: well structured. The risk that it breaks existing behaviour is low so I think you can integrate this whenever you feel comfortable with it.Regarding stream organisation
column12: IMO the weak element in the chain is dvdplayer\'s class CSelectionStreams. The constraint of having no gaps and the very limited options of adding new streams from new sources makes life hard in the demuxers. If you consider to revamp this class go ahead :) up to you."'

column10: b"b' Thanks ;)Maybe we can discuss this on irc at some point.'"
b'b" @FernetMenta I was thinking about giving each stream a uuid. Imo that shouldn\'t be a problem performance wise
column11: but needs a bigger rewrite. What do you think?"'

column10: b"b' are you talking about CSelectionStreams?'"
b'b" yes
column11: and as a consequence the demuxers\' streams (or actually the other way round)"'

column10: b"b' CSelectionStreams really needs some rework and if you take this job
column11: it is highly appreciated. IMO the biggest flaw of this class is that it does not allow gaps between streams. For this reason ffmpeg and pvr demuxers have become messy and error prone because on mpegts steams like an additional audio language may disappear. Currently those demuxers map a uid (PID) to a stream index
column12: which is quite ugly. Would be great if this could be simplified. I think this is what you mean by adding a uid
column13: right?'"

column10: b"b' Yes
column11: with uuid I mean using crossguid and the like'"

b"b' [PVR] Fix crash in PVR::CPVRClient::GetDriveSpace (Trac #15942)'"
b'b" I\'m not 100% sure about the root cause
column11: but the various stack traces I got show that the CPVRClient instance on which GetDriveSpace gets called is NULL. Thus
column12: my simple fix should prevent the crash. Root cause could be a multithreading issue. One piece of code looks suspicious to me:  CSingleLock lock(m_critSection); ...  {  unsigned int iPrevious = m_iAddonInfoToggleCurrent;  if (((int) ++m_iAddonInfoToggleCurrent)   m_iAddonInfoToggleCurrent = 0;  For a short moment m_iAddonInfoToggleCurrent can have a value that is too large. This piece of code reads m_iAddonInfoToggleCurrent without a mutex. /* safe to read unlocked */  for (unsigned int i = 0; i < m_iAddonInfoToggleCurrent; i++)  activeClient++;   if (activeClient->second->GetDriveSpace(&iBackendkBTotal
column13: &iBackendkBUsed) == PVR_ERROR_NO_ERROR)  So far so bad
column14: activeClient might point () due to the potential multithreading issue here. But I was unable to actually find out the use case where the writing code runs in another thread than the reading code... strange. @opdenkamp mind taking a look?"'

column10: b"b' for the record: #6732'"
b'b" That comment in the second piece of code seems wrong
column11: if it can be mutated by another thread it\'s not safe to read and absolutely no safe to loop over it"'

column10: b'b" At best this fix will make the error be more random but it won\'t fix the underlying issue that you\'re looping over shared state without a lock"'

b"b' Sure. Protecting the reading code will avoid the iterator running out of scope. This is probably a better way to take with the problem. But what is the _actual_ root cause?  Under which circumstances do multiple cguiinfo threads run in parallel? This imo must be the case to run into the crash. But having more than one of this threada makes no sense for me... Honestly
column11: trying my best
column12: but all this makes not too much sense for me. This drives me nuts! '"

column10: b'b" The code in void CPVRGUIInfo::UpdateBackendCache(void) makes no sense.It calls into AddonInfoToggle which locks before updating the variable
column11: it then calls lots of methods on a pointer completely unprotected and then takes a lock again to update string variables. Why not protect that which will make us crash horribly? Also I\'m not really sure that the idea to use a counter to keep track of which client to update is a good idea when storing the clients in a map. Items can change places from under you if something\'s inserted depending on it\'s key. activeClients comes from g_PVRClients and is using raw pointers so any change in g_PVRClients can kill this code. That\'s what I\'ve found so far"'

column10: b'b" ~~oh
column11: just thought of it
column12: since the data lives in g_PVRClients no locking in UpdateBackendCache will work
column13: needs to be locked in g_PVRClients during the whole op or copied using smart pointers to avoid deletion~~The typedef fooled me
column14: I see that it\'s actually using std::shared_ptr"'

column10: b'b" quick and dirty possible fix Paxxi@83f29c4a9306ce33fd4d0889f00ca92394dbfb72AddonToggleInfo uses m_iActiveClients which may not match what we got as iActiveClients and we end up with a nullptr **this is to show the issue
column11: it\'s not a production ready fix as there\'s still a race condition present** @ksooo it seems your first fix could work fine
column12: I was reading on the phone and it looked like it  was part of the for loop."'

column10: b"b' @paxxi Did a little more brain debugging and now I understand it. This is not a multithreading issue. Happens also if there is only one guiinfo thread involved and at some certain point in time count of active clients drops. Following scenario:Very first call to UpdateBackendCache:assume iActiveClients is 2.AddonInfoToggle gets called and sets m_iAddonInfoToggleCurrent to 0back in UpdateBackendCache: activeClient will be set to first vector element
column11: m_iActiveClients will be set to 2=2nd call to UpdateBackendCache:assume iActiveClients is still 2.AddonInfoToggle gets called and sets m_iAddonInfoToggleCurrent to 1back in UpdateBackendCache: activeClient will be set to second vector element
column12: m_iActiveClients will be set to 2 (no change in value)=3rd call to UpdateBackendCache:assume iActiveClients now is 1.AddonInfoToggle gets not called
column13: thus m_iAddonInfoToggleCurrent is unchanged (current value is 1!)UpdateBackendCache: activeClient will be set to second vector element
column14: which is not actually present='"

column10: b"b' [aml] Override resolutions for  hdmi edid data.'"
b'b" Read user supplied disp_cap from userdata directory if it exists. Some  combinations fail to handshake valid edid info
column11: preventingkodi from using supported  rates when \'adjust displayrefresh rate\' is used. Only implemented for amlogic hardware.  in native aml format. Example file:720p1080p720p50hz1080p50hz1080p24hz"'

column10: b"b' Implemented what was requested in #7251.Hope it was done in the correct way. Git manages to confuse me a bit more than C++.'"
b"b' jenkins build this please @koying '"

b'b\' Code looks ok and could probably be applied to the  file in the same directory which also uses disp_cap. I sometimes have the same issue with disp_cap only containing the two words "null edid" despite trying different cables and hdmi sockets. It seems the code was going to be merged last June but I think it got missed since I can\\\'t see it in master yet. Thanks.\''
b"b' Is there anything keeping this from being merged?'"
b"b' That new user supplied file gets priority over possible correctly detected modes
column11: which are skipped in that case and only read if reading the user supplied file fails / not exists. It is a nice feature (as you can boot without TV and so on)
column12: but also the modes are not everything
column13: think of HDMI handshake for e.g. hd audio
column14: which is currently WIP for AML. Let me ping possible future maintainers of AMLogicEGL to see if they like it that way. @codesnake @christiantroy @koying is that fine with what you have in mind concerning maintainability?'"

column10: b'b" From my experience I know that some Amlogic-based boxes sometimes cannot read EDID properly so / returns null. The proper way in this case is to fix the kernel driver. But this is not always possible
column11: so from my point of view we should have some default list of basic display modes hardcoded in source code rather than requiring user to put a file into userdata. But on the another hand still also good idea to allow to override the basic display mode list. EDIT: I\'m OK with this PR
column12: it doesn\'t break anything."'

column10: b'b" @mapfau please take a look at the following lines. url This creates the internal group (id: -1) and push it to m_groups url This reads all groups from the database including the internal group. url Here we call for each group we found in the database. url Please take a look at this line and below. column12: the first attempt by id will fail. column10: b"b' fix trac 16159 Yes (single) / Separate is doing reverse'"

b"b' This is my attempt to fix url  Currently The yes button implies Export to single file and Button Separate Implies Export to Separate files. However when actually pressing these buttons you quickly realise the reverse is actually happening since you get prompted to select location for separate files and get asked if you wish to export artwork when selecting single... This PR makes YES the export to Separate files and the single to single and single is selected by default. Theres probably a better fix for this but idk this was calculated guesswork and I tested it to the point of seeing what you are prompted to do when pressing each button. Ideally since we are using action labels on the  buttons they would both be labelled Single /Separate and the dialog message wouldnt imply either If anyone knows please take over from here. @xhaggi @MartijnKaijser @paxxi'"

b'b" Looks sane. It\'s a bit odd that the label for the NO action is expected before the label for the YES action.The other option would be to keep the labels and negate the result of the call if we want to keep the position of the labels in the dialog."'
b'b" i\'d say we should negate the option if that would make label placement consistent"'
b"b' Thats sounds too complicated for me to do :D SO if you tell me what to do I can. As long it solves the issue ...'"
b'b" It\'s not complicated. Instead of changing the label IDs you put a in front of  ."'

b"b' [PVR] Add Timer:  EPG based TimerType based on EPG info being present'"
b'b\' While implementing  changes for series recording i came across the situation that when "Add Timer" screen is launched from the Timer List
column11: my Repeating Epg TimerType was available (eventhough there is no way on this screen to "select" an EPG item to associate).  Meanwhile my Single EpgBased TimerType was not shown. But when creating a custom timer from the
column12: EPG Data IS passed in
column13: and so I expected both my Single and Repeating EPG Based timer types to be available here
column14: but only the Repeating one was (as per above) This turned out to be because the existing implementation always removes OneTimeEpgBased but never RepeatingEpgBased. My change makes any EpgBased timer type be  based on whether EpgInfo is present.  This means they are not shown when launched from the Timer List (and there is no way to choose any EPG info) but when created from the Guide they are both available. Pings: @ksooo @metaron-uk @Jalle19 \''

column10: b'b\' Sorry
column11: -1 from my side. Your change breaks existing implementations.This is exactly the intended behavior. Whether an epg based timer can be created has nothing to do with the presence of an epg tag at the moment of creation. A repeating timer ( a "recording rule") supposed to search epg to find epg tags matching the rule will not nessecarily have an epg tag associated. Those types can be created on "green field". =Also works as designed. It will be shown if you add a timer after selecting an epg tag from the epg window
column12: but not if you select "Add timer" from the timer window. As you wrote
column13: timer settings dialog currently does not offer the functionality to pick an epg event. Your expectation is correct. The logic in timer settings dialog is okay
column14: IMO. If it does not work for you
column15: there must be a bug somewhere else
column16: most probably before the timer dialog gets initialized. Maybe here? = Not always. Only for new timers. =\''

column10: b'b\' This is strange to me
column11: since in my backend an EpgBased timer means it has an EPG item associated with it.  How can you "Add Timer" from the timer screen (not guide screen) and then choose a Repeating Epg Based timer type
column12: with no way to select an EPG item on this screen? In WMC a keyword search (called a Wishlist) is not EpgBased it does not necessarily have an EPGInfo associated with it.  I have implemented these as separate timer types Single (wishlist)Repeating (wishlist)and set Manual attribute on them
column13: and can correctly select them from Timer list "Add Timer" command. On the flip side
column14: with my single (epg based) repeating (epg based) I am pretty sure I have them configured correctly
column15: but when adding a custom timer from the EPG Guide screen
column16: the Single one is removed from the types spinner
column17: due to the line of code you highlighted.  Im pretty sure that m_bIsNewTimer boolean is set true when launching this screen from "Add Custom Timer" on EPG grid and thus Single Epg Based option is ALWAYS removed whether you came from Timers screen or Guide screen\''

column10: b'b" According to Kodi\'s definition of timer types true for one-shot epg-based timers
column11: but not true for repeating epg-based timers. And this is exactly the point. The Kodi definitions and terminology do not (and don\'t need to) 100% match the wmc terms and defs. Kodi has to find generic definitions implementable by different backends
column12: each having its own (diferent) terms and defs. It is the task of the addon to bring both worlds together. You  as the addon developer must understand both worlds and translate in both directions. :-) According to Kodi\'s definition of a Repeating Epg Based timer (read my previous post) this is absolutely no problem.This should indeed not happen. I now have a clear picture. Yes
column13: you are right
column14: it\'s a bug in the timer settings dialog. Your suggestion for a fix is unfortunately not okay
column15: as I tried to point out in my previous post. I will rethink things and come up with a proper fix in another PR
column16: okay?"'

column10: b'b" Your suggestion for a fix is actually almost okay. ;-) Please change the line in question to if (type->IsOnetimeEpgBased() && !m_timerInfoTag->HasEpgInfoTag()) and adapt the comment in the line above that line accordingly and I\'m fine with this PR. Reason for the code change: we must not filter repeating epg based types as they are not required to have an epg tag as I tried to explain earlier."'

b'b" Looks like there are two issues here:1. a bug which prevents a single entry epg from appearing in the Add Custom... list (which I guess this PR will fix)2. A desire to prevent timer types which do require an associated EPG entry on initial creation from appearing in the \'Add...\' list. I remember a conversation with @janbar a while ago in which he wondered why there wasn\'t a way to prevent types appearing in the Add... menu. Imo it would be good to have a means of preventing a timer type which relies on the presence of an EPG tag for initial creation from appearing under the \'Add...\' option.(I\'m thinking of a timer type which relies on \'seriesid\'
column11: \'programid\' or some other EPG data which can\'t be specified manually) @ksooo is there already a method for doing this which @janbar and I missed?If not I\'ll add it to PR 7626 for consideration as another \'good idea\'."'

b'b\' I was also thinking overnight that it seems like we need a way for each addon to specify which timertypes are allowed to be selected on "Add Timer" from timer list
column11: and "Add Timer" when EPG info is present.  We could do this with attributes.  So for example instead of my hard coded change in this PR which hides EpgBased timers if no EPGTag is populated (which doesnt work for some addons that have the concept of an EpgBased repeating timer that doesnt have EPG Info)
column12: we should have a new attribute such as "PreventCreateWhenNoEpgInfo" and hide accordingly to that. We could have other attributes if required like "PreventCreateFromTimerList" and so on.  Rather than Kodi core making hardcoded assumptions like "all backens support a repeating epg timer with no epg info but dont support a single repeating epg timer with no epg info" this would mean each addon can decide what types are appropriate for the scenarios. EG if based on @ksooo comments earlier
column13: Kodi considers a repeating EPG timer with no epg info exists
column14: then how come not a single EPG timer with no epg info?  You said that a keyword search counts as Epg Based but in WMC you can do a keyword search either for "One Occurence" or "All Occurences".  Therefore if I am expected to implement my keyword based timers as Epg based rather than Manual based as I have done
column15: then I need Single AND Repeating to be available
column16: not just Repeating. I am not asking "someone else" to do the work
column17: but seeking consensus before doing it.  Using attributes to define whether a TimerType should be hidden on Timer Creation sounds like a good idea to me.  Which scenarios do we need to cater for?  Currently we have uncoveredPreventCreateFromTimerListPreventCreateWhenNoEpgInfo(perhaps also PreventCreateFromGuide?) anything else?\''

Let me be a little bit more specific:If the touchscreen resolution is for example 1280x800 the touch input should place the  point exactly within this range of points on the  screen when pressing on the screen. if the touchscreen controller sends its touch position in his own coordination system for example 1920x1920  we need to align this system to the screen. issue on many self made media centers:with standard kodi compiled from source or instaleld by package manager (or OpenElec
column12: ...) the mouse do not follow the touch input exactly.in my case I\'m only able to use 2/3 of the screen per touch input ==So I can not get to the bottom right corner and need a additional mouse to handle elements in that dead section."'

b'b" @koying: Not every touchscreen controller sends absolute coordinates. Some sends 0
column11: 0 for top
column12: left and max_x
column13: max_y for bottom
column14: right. Others can send 0
column15: 0 for top
column16: left and some very large data for bottom
column17: right. And some other doesn\'t send either 0
column18: 0 for top
column19: left but instead some very large data. That\'s why some calculations must be done. Usually kernel module handles touchscreen and we would expect this function there. But kernel devs doesn\'t agree. That\'s why it must be done in userspace.This is handled in X server. But in case Kodi runs without X this must be handled in Kodi itself. Or with some other userspace program. For my personal use in OpenELEC I made one daemon which uses tslib touchscreen library and creates one new virtual input device Kodi uses. Also calibration addon to calibrate in case touchscreen needs that. But if Kodi is getting some touchscreen support I would expect this function also to be present."'

column10: b'b\' First step in improving browsing for classical music is to process the standard tags for composer (TCOM)
column11: conductor (TPE3) and Ensemble.  This could be considered a work in progress
column12: but could be merged as an initial phase providing limited user improvements. Unlike popular music albums which usually have one album artist
column13: classical music frequently has multiple artists soloists
column14: conductor
column15: orchestra and composer. The composer is the primary element used when selecting what you want to play
column16: and although not a performer most classical music files will have composer name in the artist (or album artist) tag just to make them accessible on the various players (inc. Kodi).  Musicbrainz also treats composer as an artist. Once the artist list includes a mix of composers
column17: orchestras
column18: conductors
column19: soloists (as well as pop artists)  it is useful to be able to see just one kind of artist at a time. Lack of player support for these tags means that users will have incorporated them in the artist and album artists tags. Rather than have extra tables or song attributes for these tags
column20: my idea is to use these tags to identify the "role" that an artist has in the recording. An approach that could easily be extened to other as yet unsupported tags
column21: but wanting to try the concept first. This means a database change adding "role" as a attribute of the song_artist and album_artist tables. The UI aspect of this change is made available through folder type custom nodes. For example Implementing this change I have looked at the inital work on artist credits discussion between Night199UK and JMarshall. The original intentions to use JoinPhrase to construct artist names and get rid of the various strArtist and use of strutils::Join everywhere. This did not happen
column22: and despite being used to store " / " JoinPhrase is not used
column23: neither is bFeatured. I have therefore removed these attributes (replacing them with role). I really have checked carefully before doing that. Not sure how much more of the design I should describe at this point
column24: or if there is somewhere better for design documentation? I am hoping we can move the music library forward despite the lack of experienced dev team members even using the music side let along having time to consider design changes. From other PR it seems that @Montellese
column27: and @zag2me are most likey to have an interest in music . Lots to discuss I am sure!!\''

column10: b'b\' Excellent
column11: thanks for getting stuck into this @DaveTBlake.  The design and concept is good
column12: and I like the way you are thinking about the different cases for tagging. The new "Role" DB field is an great idea and could work with electronic artists as well. I think in general we should follow how musicbrainz classifies artists. As always
column13: can\\\'t comment too much on the code but the change in general looks good. One small thing is that maybe its a good idea to add new tags in separate commits.\''

For readability it might be a good idea to split into several commits (maybe one for removing strArtist /JoinPhrase and one for adding roles)? As we discussed over PM\\\'s

column10: b'b" You might want to backup your folder the first few times you do this.Rebases will probably be easier if you do them as often as possible and with as few commits as possible. Just choose \'Rebase...\' from the context menu on your folder. In that dialog
column11: be sure that you are on this branch. If you don\'t have the official kodi repo as remote configured hit \'...\' and add a new remote with the url url  be sure to fetch it. Then you can select whatever-you-namedas Upstream.You should now see your three commits
column12: we\'re basically getting a fresh master and adding your three commit ontop of it. Hit \'Start rebase\'
column13: if you hit conflicts

column15: check the log and try to compile. Just so we\'re sure everything is fine.If you have done that and everything is fine
column16: just push and select the checkbox for \'unknown changes\'. Double check your remote
column17: it should be your remote NOT the kodi remote. (you shouldn\'t have rights but it\'s always good to know where your pushing to)"'

column10: b"b' I have reworked this PR incorporating lots of good suggestions from @evilhamster  and broadened the scope so offering general improvement not just classical music specific. It adds processing for the following tags:COMPOSER (TCOM)CONDUCTOR (TPE3)LYRICIST (TEXT)REMIXER (TPE4)ENSEMBLE / BAND / ORCHESTRA (TXXX:Ensemble)ARRANGER
column11: ENGINEER
column12: PRODUCER
column13: DJMIXER
column14: MIXERPERFORMER=artist (instrument) (TIPL and TMCL) These tags are all about people (or groups of people) that contribute in some way to the recording as musicians or are in some other way involved. They are added to the music library as artists with a role. They can be listed separately from general artists (those scanned from the albumartist and artist tags) using custom nodes which can be configured to reflect the users interests. They will not be displayed on the original artist lists
column15: so those not interested in this extra data will be uneffected.  I have modified JSON interface to return the stored data for songs
column16: either as an array or role and name or composer
column17: conductor
column18: orchestra
column19: lyricist strings specifically.  I have added Info lables (no point having the data unless it is made available):  where XXXXXXX is role description e.g. composer
column20: will return is there are any artists with that role in the library. In addition to the standard roles: Composer
column21: Conductor
column22: Orchestra
column23: Lyricist
column24: Remixer
column29: Mixer this is flexible so that any role derrived from  tags e.g. soloist
column30: drummer etc. can be used. Similarly will return artist name(s) for the artist(s) that play that role for the song. and work similarly to cast
column31: returning all the contributors in a list with line-feeds. Changes to the Song Info Dialog are needed to make use of these lables. A test build is already available url You will also want to download the following custom node files url  User testing is being discussed here url I would like to get this merged because I am fed up with rebasing
column32: but realise it is a bigger step in one PR than I originally intended.'"

b'b\' So as I feared this was pushed without @DaveTBlake reporting any of my concerns so that @Montellese have the correct information to validate .... Why the changes to GetArtists is wrong : 1) It adds new filter role and roleid on data that is not part of artists and can not be get by anyone. This is as an API definition quite wrong. (And the fact that there\\\'s a wrong precedence does not validate the fact that new bad things should be added !) 2) It adds an hidden undocumented filter on roleid = 1. So now the GetArtists do not return all Artists from the table but only some based on a filter that no one is aware of. 3) To get all artists you need to filter on roleid = -1
column11: first it\\\'s not documented
column12: but more wrong : You need to use an undocumented internal magic number to do a filter on a public API. Completely insane.(And not talking about the fact that doing that filter returns data that you can\\\'t really use since you can\\\'t apply the filter manually since you do not have access to roledid and role.) About naming : There\\\'s some major incoherence too
column13: it seems it\\\'s all over contributor roles
column14: but then it\\\'s  so not related to audio or contributors and not really clear as it can have many meanings. "" do not include or return roleid only the role string
column15: also not cool for any proper usage of the API. Come on it means API consumers can not recreate a proper joint and need to use join on Strings
column16: really on strings ? (Specially when due to current api limitation this joint table is mandatory to recreate correct data for offline use ?) This is IMO a lot of things that should have been at least discussed with the proper people
column17: and not hidden. Really disappointed that JSON like that was merged
column18: this open doors to anything in future and is not toward a better base
column19: unlike what some others guys from the team tries to achieve !\''

If you use 2 filter + "and" you\\\'ll have all songs where toto is an artist and there\\\'s a composer (but composer could be anyone). @DaveTBlake when you ask for advice to someone that have the knowledge and despite more than 20 PM / Mails you decide to ignore all the messages about your changes being bad and / or useless you should at least have taken time to ask someone else for confirmation. @Montellese do not use / care about music so he only checked syntax for JSON part without having all the necessary element to understand all the problems you integrated. And since you were aware of the problems but decide to merge
column12: this is called sabotage. Sorry to go public about our exchanges but Kodi integrity is important at least to me.\''

column10: b"b' this feels wrong. init window is only called at application start
column11: not when switching refresh rates'"

column10: b'b\' That\\\'s the problem. On droid
column11: refresh rate switching is done by specifying a "preferred refresh rate" on a window.In that case
column12: the window (i.e. the application window) is destroyed and recreated
column13: leading to this additional ::InitWindow which
column14: without this patch
column15: will take the configured refresh rate rather than the one from the renderer.\''

column10: b"b' You should handle this in Windowing without decaying platform independent code. X11 does destroy and recreate the main window too. ::InitWindows is supposed to be called only on application launch.'"
b'b" X11 can create its own native window. In android\'s case
column11: it is given to the native application by the OS
column12: we do not create it ourselves. The simple fact of switching apps can lead to the window being destroyed and another one being recreated on resume
column13: so it\'s all waterfall."'

column10: b'b" I am trying to say that Application::InitWindow is the wrong place for doing this. The ifdeffery is the best indicator. Why don\'t you kill Application::InitWindow in favour of a method CWinSystem::InitWindow. Then overwrite this method for Android"'

column10: b'b" The problem is not about improving ;) We all want that. The problem is the impact on average Joe that do not understand things
column11: and certainly does not read a Changelog ;) To improve for Jarvis a non intrusive way as discussed a lot would be : Scan content like your PR that would only scan tags in library. This is OK since it\'s user job to have correct tags. But default direct online scanning with a default scraper (in English so not good for many) that will override data from users without he knowing and having control about what is overridden that is not the way to go after. For Jarvis it should be as proposed by some of the other Team member a popup scrape with online data ? Yes / No and with a warning text saying that it can override some of the user TAGS. This would at least reduce a lot support as the warning will be visible before the guy click ok and not hidden in a 150 line changelog on a web page."'

column10: b"b' Add options to reduce framerate when Kodi is paused or not playing back video'"

b'b" Attached is a proposal to conditionally reduce the render framerate when Kodi is either in Pause or is not playing. I started discussing this on the Kodi forums here: url  Here is what the new settings look like:![reduceframerate]url  In terms of code it\'s just a few modifications in CApplication::Render to add two new behaviours: 1. use the existing limitFrames mechanism if it looks like a good time to slow down. 2. modify the sleep loop to check CWinEvents::GetQueueSize every 100 milliseconds (worst case) to reduce exit latency."'
b"b' Gui setting is not acceptable. Problem must be solved without any additional settings. '"
b'b" @un1versal: ok next time I\'ll rebase instead of merge@MartijnKaijser: I commented on this in the forums.  "'
b'b" I didn\'t mean to close it just yet."'
b'b"  In summary
column11: this proposal saves power
column12: but is too much like a hack that will add support complexity if integrated into master. A proper solution may become more viable once the render thread becomes split from the main thread. So from the master-branch perspective I\'ll close the PR. "'

column10: b"b' Fix (ALBUM)ARTISTS tag processing to allow for item separator'"

b'b\' Fixes bug in the way ARTISTS and ALBUMARTISTS tags are processed.  A user spotted that with ID32v3 tags and multiple artists the artist names were being added to the library with a leading and trailing space.  The original implementation #7281 had hard coded slash (no spaces) as the separator for 2.3
column11: not sure why and @evilhamster does not seem to be around to ask.  The original processing also assumed that in other tag formats the ARTISTS tag values would not use a separator
column12: so general processing added to cover this situation of ARTISTS = "AAA / BBB"  any format. K***\\\\* version to follow.\''

column10: b'b" I\'m not 100% sure of the implications that might be caused by dropping but shouldn\'t be a problem (if the RC is not that soon)Otherwise the code seems fine to me"'
b'b\' @Razzeee I have searched through the Git conversations to see if I could find why it had  hard coded slash (no spaces) processing for v2.3
column11: but didn\\\'t discover anything. You know me
column12: I hate to change other people\\\'s work without understanding it fully. I can only guess it might have something to do with the v2.3 spec that says "/" is always the separator for TPE1 (artist) and TCOM (composer). Of course this has the " problem"
column13: and so regardless of what the spec says Kodi applies the separator setting to spltting TPE1 and all the other tags for all the versions. It makes most sense to be consistent and have TXXX:ARTISTS treated the same as the other tags. No idea how many of our users tag with v2.3 and use the ARTISTS tag (along with MusicbrainzIDs)
column14: not manys I suspect. But at least one does and had reasonably used the default space-slash-space to separate names in the ARTISTS tag (just like they do in TPE1 or TCON etc.)
column15: only to get  space issues. If any users have tagged v2.3 with just slash as a spacer in this one tag it seems reasonable to ask them to change it. And we will only discover them
column16: if they exist
column17: in real world use. @Rouzax
column18: @Scott967 and @zag2me perhaps you could give this a try especially with any v2.3 tagged files with ARTISTS tag
column19: as you did the original PR. I\\\'ll set a test build going to make that easier.\''

column10: b'b\' For the Artist tag "space slash space" has always been used precisely because of the so called  problem
column11: so it makes sense to me for that to be used for support of the Artists tag.\''

column10: b'b" I\'ve always tested with 2.4 tags because that\'s is what all my files are tagged with. Still have the test files for 2.3 and 2.4 tags if you need them. "'
b"b' A test build here url  Would be good if anyone has files tagged with v2.3 and using ARTISTS tag
column11: could try it out. Always better if someone else tests work.'"

column10: b"b' Here you go
column11: these are the original testfiles like url They are royalty free MP3 from url  Tagged as:Various Artists Hed Kandi: Miami 2015And as:Mark Ronson Uptown Special With these settings:![image]url  Also the same songs tagged with id v2.3 With these settings:![image]url  Downloadurl '"

column10: b"b' OK I have tested with the original test files from @Rouzax
column11: but more importantly I have heard back from some user testing too (live testing always good). So this is good to go.'"
