column10: b"b' [PVR] [guiinfo]: Fix start time and duration for channels with no epg data.'"
b'b\' Before this PR
column11: start time and duration for channels without epg data was always 0 and 0. If backend supports timeshifting
column12: these values should point to "timeshift buffer start time" and "timeshift buffer end time minus timeshift buffer start time". As a nice side effect of this change
column13: you now can use skip+/and seek  (timeshift) in this kind of channels. @Jalle19 @xhaggi mind taking a look.\''

column10: b"b' hmm. This looks wrong. You change code of GetStartTIme(). This should have no influence on whether timeshift works or not.'"
b'b\' What I mean with "timeshift works" is not that it was technically broken
column11: but that it is now possible to activate it from the UI. Just try it out: Tune to a channel without epg and hit skip+/or seek . Without this PR
column12: nothing happens. Setting GUI start time and duration for this scenario to timeshift buffer start time and timeshift buffer end minus buffer start imo is correct as for playing channels without epg data this is exactly the start and length of the stream currently playing.\''

column10: b"b' The fact that this workaround is required is a good indicator that things went wrong before. Instead of complicating behaviour I would simplify it. The playing stream should know this info and actually our interface to DVDInputStream has this method:url  The problem is that this call is directed to PVRManager and GUIInfo instead of to the addon. It could be that simple:The playing stream knows it start and end time. It is also aware of it timeshift mode. Single source of truth
column11: no issue. The current code:Backend feeds epg data to Kodi. If a stream is started
column12: we lookup the epg and use this info for display of starttime. This information came from the backend
column13: hence the backend does know the information. Nice spaghetti code:GUI queries player for display timeplayer asks stream for display timein case of pvr this is directed to PVRFilePVRFile uses global to PVRManagerPVRManager passes the call to PVRGUIInfo (hey gui again)PVRGUIInfo has the info from EGP Do you agree that something goes wrong?'"

column10: b'b\'  Not literally wrong
column11: but "not good". This is not a workaround. GUI info when timeshifting channels without epg data currently is wrong start : 0
column12: duration 0. This PR fixes this. Maybe I should rename it to reflect that it actually does nothing else. The fact that this change makes timeshift actually possible UI-wise seems then just to be a side effect.\''

column10: b'b\' Renamed PR and commit plus adapted description to reflect what this PR actually does and that everything else is just a side effect. ;-) EDIT: Will take care of the "spaghetti code" problem that was not introduced by this PR and that @FernetMenta mentioned in another PR.\''

b"b' We are in early alpha and have plenty of time to fix it properly. I rather have it broken than a workaround like this that has the effect that the issue gets forgotten. @ksooo if you going to cur the spaghetti code
column11: this change is not needed.'"

column10: b"b'  This change is unrelated to the spagehtti code you mentioned. I want the GUI info fixed.'"
b"b' It is related because this entire method here is wrong. StartTime has to come from player only.'"
b"b' Giving up.'"

column10: b'b" Just remembered some of you guys saying
column11: addons shouldn\'t log by default
column12: because core devs are annoyed by it. Could have sworn it was you or @martijnKaijser . That\'s why I got a setting in  you need to enable additionally to debug logging to get any logs at all.  I can try to find that forum post tomorrow again. "'

column10: b"b' no need to look for that conversation
column11: i remember it :-) some of my addons also have a setting to enable logging but it is a total nightmare.the instructions to enable it are in the first post of the addon support thread
column12: but no one ever reads it. i admit having a global setting (with proper instructions on the debuglog wiki page) is better than adding such a setting to each individual addon.... would like to hear some opinions from other addon devs as well.'"

column10: b'b" I think that we shouldn\'t remove the different log levels. THAT will make it really hard to see which log message is of importance and which one isn\'t. I don\'t really have a strong opinion about  addon log messages in our log. I\'m not even sure what the current state is but IMO there are three options:1. keep everything as it is and log everything into our log file2. only log info
column11: warning and errors into our log file and provide a global switch for debug logging3. don\'t log anything into our log file and provide a global switch to enable all addon logging"'

column10: b'b" 1. Create multiple logfile for each component like OpenELEC does. I\'m not sure about the consequences
column11: but I liked the idea. "'

column10: b'b" Btw at the current state of the pr only fatal from addons will be logged. For everything else you need to enable debug logging and the component logging. And yes loosing log levels is bad
column11: but I don\'t think there is code in place for components with log levels so far? Not sure how hard to add it is. "'

column10: b'b" Love this idea :) Currently it\'s horrible when a user sends a 10 MB Kodi logs for support."'
b"b' That would be pretty easy if we could finally decide to move to a proper logging framework / library and to which one.'"

b"b' So how would splitting it actually work when i have python addon using json-rpc as interface. Need to check both logs? If python is moved to component logging it should be default ON. Also loosing the loglevels is not wanted.Having a special setting per addons is still highly wanted cause multiple addons spamming the log is pretty much useless. So if you want extra debugging for your addon you need to have a switch and it should not be spamming by default as that makes the log useless for others'"
b'b" I don\'t know what those addons would log
column11: but from my experience
column12: JSON RPC logs are spammed by tons of addons / remotes. So having the split you can have a better addon log to find the problem
column13: then if the error indicate a JSON problem you have the timestamp to easily find your JSON RPC call hidden in the middle of all other calls."'

column10: b"b' splitting up logs will be horrible. addon issues can be caused be a lot of other things besides the python code itself. corrupt databases
column11: failed internet connection
column12: whatever. when i ask users with problems for a log file
column13: i want a full logfile
column14: with every single bit of info included.'"

column10: b"b' removing addon logs from the debug log will make it nearly impossible to see if an addon causes general issues in kodi.'"

column11: removing of carriage return
column12: and force a component value like default or none for lines without one ?  This would allow a simple regexp parsing and filtering for more efficiency no ?'"

b"b' Well would be custom tool ;) But parsing a file with a more or less fixed format with a regexp is a 4 line script in most OS. For the logs to be compatible with most tools it would need much more change and move to a well known format.'"

column10: b"b' Currently  hijack the  thread for their purposes and inject commands and whatever. That can cause severe video stuttering an a whole bunch of other negatives. Once the render thread is on its own and transformation finished
column11: communication with it will be asynchronous (hw acceleration is async anyway). Assume that the render thread may be waiting 40ms for vertical retrace
column12: pretending response times in a range of 1ms makes no sense.If the render thread finds any commands in a skin
column13: it will send those to the input thread for processing.'"

column11: remember last .'"

column10: b'b" My first attempt to make a little change to Kodi that I think is a improvement.This makes the SubtitleDialog remember the last service used
column11: and also the last search instead of always using
column12: and searching
column13: the first service in the list. The intent is that last search should only be remembered for the current video playing
column14: and if the playback is stopped and the SubtitleDialog is opened for another video only the last service is remembered. But I do think that what I do in StopPlaying isn\'t the right way to do it
column15: or if I even use CGUIMessage the right way?"'

column10: b'b" There\'s an option in settings to chose the preferred subtitle provider. Isn\'t this overriding that option?"'
b'b" No
column11: the first time the dialog opens the preferred subtitle provider is used
column12: if one is selected in the settings. And if that provider gives you the subtitles you need this patch does nothing besides remember the search so there is no need for a new search the next time you open the dialog
column13: if the first subtitle you download wasn\'t good. But if your preferred provider don\'t have any subtitles and you choose to search another one
column14: and download the first from that provider and that subtitle is bad also. This patch will let you continue to find a good subtitle from the last provider used
column15: instead of always defaulting to a provider you already tried and that didn\'t give you good subtitles."'

column10: b'b" @jjd-uk I don\'t stop you from changing it but here my thoughts. I think there are many users who connect their HTPC via HDMI to a 2.0 setup. They choose passthrough because they are misguided and will suffer from lower quality by transcoding. I think the users with 5.1 setups are more inclined to read through the settings."'
b"b' I think must agree with @fernetmenta on this. '"
b'b\' The AC3 transcode change was mainly meant to simplify things for the SPDIF users
column11: as at the moment the "receiver capable" settings are hidden at the Standard setting level
column12: so enabling passthrough would automatically give them 5.1 without having uncovering the "receiver capable" settings. However I respect the view that it might not be a good idea to enable a setting that would result in a degradation of quality. So since no one else seems enthused by the idea of this change I\\\'m happy to remove it.\''

column11: but I think we should keep supporting of 32 bit version. It makes no sense to install x64 windows for HTPC with 4GB mem. '"

column10: b"b' @afedchin: Think of CPU intrinsics. Especially SSEX or later can be enabled by default.'"
b'b" @fritsch intrinsics aren\'t a reason to drop x86 support."'
b'b" @afedchin the increased memory space is a common misconception about 64 bit. Yes it\'s valuable for some applications but not for us
column11: the important thing for us are things like increased registers and register space and other improvements to the cpu  architecture.  The only reason for us to keep 32bit support is if we want to run on 32bit windows which is pretty rare these days and can mostly be found on older low powered machines. "'

column10: b'b" \\xe2\\x80\\xa6tings back to services & combine with webserver settings. A bit more minor reshuffling to get as many rough edges for the settings refactor ironed out as possible before release. Following feedbck it seems I unintentionally made life slightly more difficult for those users that use the json-rpc remote control apps. Idea of Control in Interface section was to group settings for both physical and app remotes
column11: but I forgot you still need to enable the webserver to use json-rpc. This PR places a Input category to System (effectively old Input Devices) ![image]url  Then moves the json-rpc app settings to a new Control category in Services
column12: and combines these with the webserver settings. Therefore all settings to get the remote apps working are now in the one window. ~~Also since the webserver is required to be enable to use json-rpc app i\'ve introduced a dependency in the settings~~ (removed from pr) ![image]url "'

column10: b'b" Seems it\'s way harder to not care about something I cared for 7 years :) Anyway some details about those settings :**There\'s no relation at all between WebServer and the 2 settings in application control.** Web server is one way to use JSON. The other way is JSON over TCP that is enabled with the application control setting. Most application use both but they are really independent settings. But (it\'s a very very big but) the application control settings
column11: primarily manage **Event Server** that is used also for hardware remotes and many other things. The allow remote control from app on this systems needs to be on by default even with no http as it\'s needed by default on Mac see @Memphiz Event Server recent experiments. Anyway no one really know those subtilities and in future a separation of Event Server and JSON over TCP could avoid some of the recent miss understandings. And thanks for putting those settings back where users seek them :)"'

b"b' [settings] make skin settings button more obvious'"
b'b\' There\\\'s been a number of comments over the years that access to the skin specific settings is not obvious enough to a new users
column11: thus they miss out on the options to configure what\\\'s shown on main menu for example. I\\\'ve tried to do this in as low impact way as possible
column12: so as I see it there are two options: 1) A simple labelling to "Configure skin settings.." so the wording points it\\\'s something to be selected
column13: plus the UI convention of have three trailing dots "..." to suggest there\\\'s something more. ![image]url  2) Move this setting to it\\\'s own Group then similar to above have a "Configure..." label for the button to suggest something to be selected. ![image]url  For easy comparison this PR currently contains both options. As well as trying to make access to these settings more obvious in "Interface" -![image]url  as well as "Interface" -What are peoples thought? @MartijnKaijser @phil65 @ronie @BigNoid @HitcherUK \''

column10: b'b" 1) Autointerlace of renderer is maximum crap and won\'t survive v182) deint method is stored in video db with file. assume the deint method is vdpau temporal. now you disable vdpau and play the video. you still want deinterlacing but now you need a different method"'

b'b\' Yeah that\\\'s right. I think the codec should not cope with that. I also want to avoid a dependency on the renderer itself. What do you suggest? I think the easiest thing would be to remove this "per video" setting and add an option to set the default deinterlacing method in the menu.\''

column10: b"b' heh? SetFilters is only called for sw decoding'"

column11: exactly. That\'s the reason. If we are called with e.g. VDPAU_TEMPORAL and we find out that this method is not existent
column12: e.g. !m_pHardware we need to be prepared and have this YADIF as fallback. I thought this was all about it."'

column10: b"b' make process info hold a list of currently available deint methods. those can be updated (or trigger update) in RenderManager::Configurepass current deint method to getFallbackDeintMethod and return fallback if not in the listgui calls to VideoPlayer::Supports can be directed to processInfo instead of renderer'"

b'b" I don\'t like that approach for 3 reasons:a) RenderManager needs to know which decoder (e.g. pictureFormat is related to which deinterlacing / scaling / whatever method)b) a) could be encapsulated into processInfo
column11: though we would get a direct connection between RenderManager and processInfo
column12: while this would then be used / called from various points in the codec) if we decide for that approach a whole lot of ifdeffery would come into processInfo to map the relation between the deinterlace methods and the hw dec formats. Only the deint methods are available via IPlayer.h without ifdefs"'

column10: b"b' no single ifdef is required. Render does already know
column11: it implements all the Supports methods. we just need to loop over all deint methods and push the supported ones to processInfo. '"

column13: and it\'s critical that it works) will be auto-updated

b'b\' @tamland it seems indeed to mark  skins incompatible and switches to default skin. However is does this check before it fetches data from the newer repo which does compatible . So now all current installed versions are marked "disabled" while it should probably first fetch the updates before just hitting everything disabled and the users needs to get everything sorted again. Additionally users are now still able to enable "incompatible" add-ons again while this should not be possible?  \''
b'b" Seems there\'s a small additional issue. Tvtunes (as example) is marked incompatible but it\'s not auto disabled while it should be.![screenshot012]url "'
b'b" Hm
column11: I think we have to make a choice to either accept that it doesn\'t automatically updates
column12: or don\'t do any disabling
column13: only warn about it. Auto updating everything before startup is not an option; this can take far too long time. What you\'re seeing with tvtunes is expected. There\'s an update for it that is marked broken
column14: but it\'s not incompatible or have unmet dependencies in any way. These are completely different things previously mushed together."'

column10: b'b\' Well if it\\\'s marked broken it should certainly be disabled. To me incompatible and broken are the same and disabled is the way to go without option to re-enable unless a fixed version is found.  Leaving user with a warning and don\\\'t disable doesn\\\'t sound like an option cause that will leave it in broken state. Forcing the user to go and hunt down Addons that do have working update but the Addon is disabled isn\\\'t a very good option as well.  Edit:Preferred would certainly be update all available before startup. Not sure what should be done if usr has auto update Addons off. Should go in same category as database upgrades and a "busy upgrading" splash with some indication it\\\'s not stuck would be ideal \''

It should still show popups (all 50 of them). It just wont be part of this startup process because logically they are completely different things. And if user have a lot of skins and addons installed
column11: a slow connection or the mirrors are slow? It\'s not hard to imagine an update like that is going to take an hour. That\'s just an unacceptable wait time. I think we need to pick our battles here. If an upgrade require some manual intervention

If we can\\\'t avoid the repeated "incompatible" messages at startup then the best short-term option would be to drop this repository from LibreELEC (unless whoever maintains it can address the incompatibility

b'b" Unsure if this is *better* than the other one... Doesn\'t it just reduce the probability of it failing
column11: slight? We definitely shouldn\'t have this in cross-platform code though; so ifdefs please."'

column10: b'b" why shouldn\'t it be cross platform? it\'s specifically done so there\'s no delay on the first try so other platforms shouldn\'t even notice a difference"'

b'b"  But when the operation *fails* (e.g on permission issues) it causes 3 unnecessary retries and  2 unnecessary seconds of blocking. For other platforms this is just unneeded code and complexity. Maybe this retry logic is better implemented in the vfs... Because if \'other software\' can block addon installation
column11: all other operations we do in kodi suffer from the exact same problem."'

column10: b'b" Yes in the bad case it will introduce a 2 second delay. I don\'t think this is an issue as it should be a very rare event on any platform. If we think that the delay will be hit often then we have bigger issue elsewhere. column10: b'b" I don\'t think you follow what the actual issue is here. During the addon install we first unzip the files in a temp folder and then we move the folder to final location. During the unzipping the folder is temp locked by the virusscanner (or whatever) and released when it\'s done. After that we can move the folder just fine. So either we try to move immediately and if that fails try again after 500ms or we just always wait 500ms to move after unzipping to not need the retry.  So no we are not screwed anyway like you stated. "'
b"b' I follow the issue
column11: but that\\xe2\\x80\\x99s not what I meant. You have no way of knowing it will work after 500ms. Something else might lock it indefinitely. If whatever it is holds it for longer than the magic number of 2 seconds
column12: it fails. You can hope and pray ofc
column13: hence not reliable. There are two moves and one remove here that must all succeed for the install to succeed.'"

column10: b'b" It\'s quite simple and fairly reliable. The issue we\'re facing is that antivirus software will notice the extracted addon files and scan them for virus. This wasn\'t an issue before when we extracted in place. Now that we extract and move there is a window where the files might be locked by an antivirus software.  The workaround allows for a reasonable amount of time for the files to be scanned and available to us.  We can\'t handle a case where the file is locked indefinitely and it\'s not our intention. This works around a specific real world scenario that\'s causing addon installs to fail. The fix is proven in v17.x as it solved all? reported issues.  moving the old addon folder and then removing it isn\'t an issue as there\'s no new files so no scan should be triggered.  One possible solution as you mentioned is to ignore pretty folder names and extract the updated version into a guid folder and point our DB to that and then skip the move. It\'s a more reliable design I think but uglier for users who tinker around in our appdata folder."'

b'b\' Testing this in windows 10 with the latest Kodi 18 build and using "install from zip file" to update a standard Estuary Skin renamed to Custom Skin gives the following results:  1. With the Custom Skin active this fails every time.  2. Changing to the default Estuary Skin and not restarting Kodi this fails every time.  3. Changing to the default Estuary Skin and restarting Kodi this is successful every time.  Case 2 should have been successful since the Custom Skin wasn\\\'t the active skin but using Sysinternals Process Explorer showed that Kodi had maintained an open file handle on the  file in the Custom Skin. This was preventing overwriting the Custom Skin with the updated version held in the temporary file. Case 3 restarting Kodi after switching to the default Estuary Skin releases the open file handle on the Custom Skin  file and the update is then successful.  Now with Kodi still running and the Custom Skin active I used Process Explorer to close the open file handle on  and then used "install from zip file" to update the Custom Skin. Success! The Custom Skin had updated correctly but since the file handle on  had been closed the skin appeared without any textures
column11: restarting Kodi solved this and showed that the skin had been correctly updated. I repeated this several times to make sure and every time the update was successful.  If one of the themes
column12: either Curial or Flat
column13: was selected in the Custom Skin then Kodi also maintained an open file handle on this which had to be closed for a successful skin update.  So perhaps the problem with updating an active skin doesn\\\'t lie with Windows locking the temporary file for some reason or other but with the texture files in the active skin being locked by Kodi itself.\''

column10: b"b' Have the JSON handler sent a custom CEvent to the slideshow class'"

b'b" When you successfully start a picture slideshow with a JSON query you won\'t receive a response until the slideshow has been closed. To reproduce send a query like this:   The reason being that the slideshow runs a new nested main loop and so
column11: until it\'s closed
column12: doesn\'t release the lock of the ThreadMessage the JSON handler is waiting at. With this patch a custom CEvent will be attached to the GUIMessage
column13: which the slideshow class will temporarily set as a member variable to be pulsed as soon as processing of the slideshow begins. All of this takes place before the new main loop processes other messages. A simpler fix would be to send a non-waiting GUIMessage
column14: but then the caller would receive an ACK before the slideshow begins handling the request.  ## Types of change  [X] Bug fix (non-breaking change which fixes an issue) [ ] New feature (non-breaking change which adds functionality) [ ] Breaking change (fix or feature that would cause existing functionality to change)  ## Checklist: [X] My code follows the [Code guidelines]url  of this project  [ ] My change requires a change to the documentation
column15: either Doxygen or wiki [ ] I have updated the documentation accordingly [X] I have read the [CONTRIBUTING]url  document [ ] I have added tests to cover my change [ ] All new and existing tests passed "'

column10: b"b' @Montellese mind having a look?'"

b'b" I updated the pull request. The idea behind using a shared pointer for the CEvent is for the main thread to be able to handle the possibility of the JSON thread dying without taking the CEvent with it. Sending over the reference to one single shared pointer obviously doesn\'t do the job so I changed it so that a second one gets sent over for the slideshow to take care of."'

b"b' @Paxxi Sending a non-waiting GUIMessage is the same as using PostMsg. And that would indeed be a simple fix for the blocking issue. But then the behavior for slideshows would be different than for (non-PVR) audio and video where JSON clients receive a response only after the request has been processed. A client would then have to repeatedly poll the player status to see if the slideshow started.'"
b'b" The difference is that SendGuiMessage is basically a legacy method intended for use by CGUI* classes. No new code outside of those should know what a CGuiMessage is or use it
column11: therefore SendMsg or PostMsg should be used. I don\'t like polling in general but waiting on an event like this can lead to unpleasant issues.  One example is that when using Kore starting a movie
column12: if a dialog opens
column13: e.g large file dialog the remote is stuck waiting on the video to start and there is no way to interact with the dialog. Sidenote
column14: God damn github close pr button. "'

column10: b'b" I reduced the change to sending a non-waiting GUIMessage
column11: which resolves the blocking issue for the moment. Right now there is no abstraction when it comes to dealing with slideshows as the JSON classes directly access the GUIWindow. That\'s a bigger task I might work on at a later time."'

column10: b'b" AE\'s clipping protection is a protection
column11: means it only does something if sound would clip otherwise. The only reason why it is not always engaged is that it requires additional processing power. So clients of AE let AE know in advance if protection is required.  If we re-add the avoidClipping setting AE\'s clipping pretection still has to be engaged if clipping may occure. That is in case of peak * gain > 1.0 because user has not enabled the setting."'

column12: then  when "replaygain reduction" is not enabled the file should still take the set amplification route to prevent clipping.\''

b"b' For addon created ListItems dont overwrite playcount data from DB'"

b"b' When displaying ListItems from an addon dont overwite the playcount with the one stored in the DB if the addon has set a playcount in the video info tag data. The addon should control what its play count is.  ## Description Default playcount in the video info tag data to -1 when creating ListItems If the playcount is -1 update that with the value from the DB if there is one
column11: otherwise set it to zero.  ## Motivation and Context I have an addon that wants to be able to set its own playcount and resume data and not have this overwritten by any local DB data Kodi has. The addon gets its play count and resume data from a remote source
column12: in this case the  server.  ## How Has This Been Tested? Tested with addon to make sure the playcount is no longer overwritten. Tested:  if playcount is set by the addon it is not overwritten.  if an addon did not setting the playcount then it is correct set from the DB value.  ## Screenshots (if appropriate):  ## Types of change  [X ] Bug fix (non-breaking change which fixes an issue) [ ] New feature (non-breaking change which adds functionality) [ ] Breaking change (fix or feature that would cause existing functionality to change)  ## Checklist: [X ] My code follows the [Code guidelines]url  of this project  [ ] My change requires a change to the documentation

b"b' [guilib] Isolate included expressions $EXP'"

b'b\' ## Description Isolate skin included expressions so that when their including condition is evaluated the order of operations matches expected behavior.  ## Motivation and Context The current behavior just replaces expressions inline
column11: which can have unexpected results if it contains an or "|" not inside brackets. Pretty sure I\\\'m missing some words
column12: so an example is in order.  Imagine an expression such as:  (
column13: MVC 3D) | Used in a visible condition with another condition like so:  $EXP[ListItemHas3D] + (Blurry3D)  The expected behavior would match

column10: b"b' Hi @tamland
column11: to remove the cpluff is not in a easy small step possible.  To change the complete addon system to new way is a big part.  Currently is this CAddonInfo still as static in CAddon class. This is must be removed complete (on next requests) and only given as shared_ptr to the addon class.  Goal is (and used on kodi-agile) that Kodi e.g. go over the addon directory
column12: if there is a addon with  becomes this by the constructor of CAddonInfo read and the class stored in a list on addon manager. What Kodi does with it does not interest. This mean also a related addon class is stll not needed and created.  After all steps are done contains the addon class only a contructor where the stored parts becomes given.  XML parsing must only be done inside this class and should not done somewhere outside. To do outside bring a lot bad parts and nothing good.  Big problem is to bring in without destroy something and allow a better review. This need for short times bad parts. Thats why I mostly use screensaver where is not so critical.  '"

column10: b'b"  Sorry but this is a horrible idea. There nothing \'bad\' about keeping it outside. It\'s called the factory pattern and it\'s great for this sort of thing. Not too long ago this exact \'inside this class\' spaghetti was removed. And the reasons for that was:  Having complex logic like parsing and filesystem code in constructor is an anti-pattern. It breaks testability.  It makes error handing complicated as your only option is to leave objects in an invalid state and work around it by setting flags (this is exactly what you have done with m_usable)  It\'s a pain to deal with configuration as every new config must be added to every constructors. Makes it a lot harder to construct something partially when needed. E.g. local addons have metadata from the filesystem and from the database
column11: and potentially also from the repository and they must all be combined.  Additionally
column12: the way this is implemented violates the single responsibility principle. now holds the info
column13: it holds state
column14: it\'s an xml parser
column15: it\'s an json parser
column16: it\'s responsible for the extensions.  The same for  : it\'s hold extension info
column17: it\'s a parser
column18: it\'s a mutable collection. This is all effects of having the classes themselves do the parsing.  The solution I explained in my previous post does not have these issues. "'

column10: b"b' Ping @FernetMenta @peak3d  This is a RFC rather than something to merge immediately. This gets AddonVideoCodec working with MMAL buffers in a platforms independent way. Other platforms will need similar adjustments.  AddonVideoCodec initially provides just the buffer size desired and the dimensions are only available later which required splitting the Configure API.  Annoyingly it uses the pixel data pointer as an identifier in the API
column11: rather than a general user data pointer
column12: so the map between pixel data pointer and videoBuffer is required.  The whole Configure API and CVideoBufferManager needs more thought when video resolution can change on the fly.'"

column10: b"b'  @popcornmix a change in resolution triggers a streamchange event in VP. VPV will open the new stream and call CVideoBufferManager::ReleasePools. The will call Released() on the pool. Implementations can use this callback and register a new pool if required. '"

b'b\' libwidevine calls "allocate" callback with only the size needed. This is done before any picture is produced and therefore there is no way to know currently what will be done with the block of memory.  @FernetMenta is this information anywhere in the codec (incl. stride) ? or is stride in the ownership of the decoder?\''
b"b' @peak3d as mentioned
column11: stride is defined by the buffer but if this is not possible with widevine we have to add SetStrides to CVideoBuffer'"

column10: b"b' @FernetMenta the decoder is NOT designed by me so I have no influence on it.'"
b'b\' Updated to use "size" as the primary configuration option and SetDimensions as a way of filling in dimensions after allocation.\''
b"b' I think its a good idea to keep both Get() methods. the one with  will be the one wich lets Buffer choose the best matching alignment as implemented today.'"
b"b' This would be dead code and keeping dead code is imo not a good idea. It can be implemented again if a client requires it for some reason'"
b"b' Updated to include passing videoBufferManager to Released callback.'"

column10: b"b' jenkins build this please (to check GLES code)'"
b'b" Just a warning that rendering through GLES will be significantly less efficient.  Prior to this PR on Pi we will directly render in the game\'s native bitmap format (e.g. RGB565
column11: RGB888
column12: RGBA32) to a separate layer without any copying required. Now
column13: then texture upload is effectively a memcpy to GPU memory
column14: followed by a format conversion to a tiled texture format. There may also be an additional format conversion before texture upload to get the image into GL_BGRA format.  A few years ago all ARM platforms rendered video through GL. But performance sucked and now all ARM platforms render video directly on a separate video plane
column15: mostly using zero copy.  I understand that for emulating 3D consoles you need GL rendering (although whether performance will  be adequate for this class of emulation is questionable). Also you may want it for shader based scanline effects. But I worry this scheme will rule out a class of emulation that previously worked acceptably but will no longer with the GL renderer.  It is possible we will want to support platform specific (e.g. MMAL) renderers for RP in the same way as we do for VP."'

column10: b'b" Agreed
column11: a MMAL renderer for RetroPlayer would be desirable. Do you have time to implement this? It\'s pretty much just a matter of copying the VP renderer and removing all the video stuff. If not
column12: I can handle this eventually.  Using MMAL for rendering would preclude the use of shaders
column13: right?"'

column10: b'b" I can help with MMAL renderer support when I get some time. Ideally MMAL would be an optional renderer alongside GL. If game uses GL or custom shaders then GL path is used otherwise use MMAL renderer.  I don\'t see a good way to use shaders alongside MMAL (you would lose the zero copy path so may as well render with GL as your pixels are already there)."'

b'b\' Most ARMs (including IMX) offer some pseudo vendor optimized GL extensions to simulate a zero copy or at least a DMA copy to the 3D GPU. Still that would also be less performant as "passthrough" rendering
column11: but perhaps some custom shader / GL code could be supported that way?  eglCreateImage might be a candidate when doing it in a standard way?\''

b'b"  My reason for writing a new renderer is partially due to the duplication in VP. For example
column11: both the sysmem video buffers and the mmal video buffers use an identical pooling strategy. By copying the existing renderers
column12: I\'ve created a much smaller
column13: more encapsulated renderer that can be refactored at a fraction of the cost
column14: and by supporting less systems my task of testing is drastically easier.  I pushed a commit that encapsulates the two pooling strategies into a single base class. My same strategy could be applied to VP
column15: but it would be much messier and touch far mode code due to the duplication.  Thanks for the sample code @FernetMenta
column16: I think this is what I\'m looking for."'

b'b"   ## Description  This is heavily work in progress and while it works at the moment it probably has some cases that re broken.  ## Motivation and Context This replaces the old files and columns with a table. It has and a reference to a file. For every time watched
column11: we add a new row.  So this is much richer than the old fields
column12: as we can have multiple  entries for the same file. We\'re basically emulating the old fields while adding the new table to use in the future.  This first implementation however will focus on only having this internal and handling it correctly in core. We will need to expose it to the outer world in a later PR.  ## How Has This Been Tested?  Very little. It seems to work fine on migration and leanback. And it also seems to safe fine on  . It also sets playCount to 0 instead of at the moment
column13: not sure if this causes regressions.  MySQL is completely untested as of now (might be broken due to me using subqueries
column14: can\'t remember if those were bad for MySQL)  ## Types of change  [ ] Bug fix (non-breaking change which fixes an issue) [ ] Improvement (non-breaking change which improves existing functionality) [x] New feature (non-breaking change which adds functionality) [ ] Breaking change (fix or feature that would cause existing functionality to change)  ## Checklist: [x] My code follows the [Code guidelines]url  of this project  [ ] My change requires a change to the documentation
column15: either Doxygen or wiki [ ] I have updated the documentation accordingly [x] I have read the [CONTRIBUTING]url  document [ ] I have added tests to cover my change [x] All new and existing tests passed   "'

column10: b'b\'  It\\\'s mainly when people choose to "restore" their saved watched statuses after creating a new library in addition to resume points this includes restoring playcount and lastplayed for movies and episodes. This will no longer be possible as:  * playcount will now be determined from row count
column11: meaning arbitrary playcounts cannot be set. Setting will not make the playcount budge from zero as the movie has never been watched in the new database * lastplayed date will now be determined from and again it will not be possible for the user to set in the new database the actual date when they last watched a movie in their old database  In addition
column12: playcount can be reset to zero using "Mark as unwatched" in the GUI.  All of this existing functionality will be lost (or worse
column13: broken) by this change.  I do now believe that deriving playcount and lastplayed from the table is not a good idea. Not only is existing functionality lost (both JSON and GUI)
column14: but it means more expensive  /  queries to derive information that is not quite the same as that which the user might want or has set. The contents of the table does not represent the "summarised" information maintained in the table which includes columns that can and will be set independently of the table.  It might at first glance appear that playcount and lastplayed columns can be replaced by a table
column15: but it turns out that this "summarised" information stored in is different and not the same as the actual number of plays
column16: or when those plays occurred.  For this reason I think we should just add the table as new functionality that is populated at the end of playback
column17: while keeping the table and existing queries as they are
column18: and don\\\'t attempt to derive playcount and lastplayed from the table because the table cannot accurately emulate these values given existing functionality (which is desirable functionality IMHO).  Adding only the table which is populated at end of playback would also make this change significantly less complex (there\\\'d also be no need to backfill the table
column19: either). If at some point in the future we determine a use for the table then the information will be there
column20: ready and waiting
column21: in the database.\''

xbmc	13323	closed	36	MilhouseVH	2018-01-06 23:59:09	259.57	+1			b'b\'  Use JSON methods to  .  url Currently the user can set any value or date they desire in the case of "restoring watched statuses" this would be the and values from their _old_ database which they would be setting in their new database.  With this PR, you\\\'ll have to fudge the numbers by creating blank rows (or deleting existing rows?) which is frankly absurd, and I\\\'m not entirely sure if it will even be possible to set a date that is prior to any date that may already exist in the table. That\\\'s the fundamental point being made here, they\\\'re NOT the same data maybe they were meant to be the same data, but because an interface exists (and is used) to set arbitrary values this data no longer represents what you think it does, or should be, and trying to make it represent what you think it should is just going to cause problems and a lot of unnecessary .  What I really think should be done is that the table is added as _new_ functionality separate and independent of the and columns in the table. If there is a requirement to expose  /  then do so as two NEW properties as this will result in a lot less complexity and users of the existing  /  functionality can continue unaffected. It\\\'s not ideal, but a better alternative than fudging the data. Adding the table without changing the table would mean there is less urgency for the JSON-RPC changes by removing the columns from the table in this PR you have altered functionality (negatively, IMHO) and there\\\'s no guarantee when or if the JSON-RPC changes will be added. I have no doubt you\\\'ll add them eventually, but you\\\'ll give yourself more time by not conflating  /  with COUNT()/MAX() in this PR.\''

column10: b'b\' Requested many times and for a long time in the forum
column11: here it comes... channel groups selector for the Guide window:  ![screenshot001]url Channel groups are displayed as a "band" on top of the epg grid. Channel groups are switched live when selecting a group in the "band". Thus
column12: a user can switch very quickly between channel groups.  The channel group selector can be turned off. There are two new view types for the Guide window "horizontal channels
column13: no group selector" and "vertical channels
column14: no group selector"

b"b' Fix crash on exit. '"

b'b\'  This crash seems to be due to the logger being set on CThreads (and Exception) using XbmcContext rather than the means prescribed by GlobalHandling.  ## Description  XbmcContext was originally supposed to be the "down payment" on a dependency injection approach to modularizing the code but it never went anywhere so it\\\'s now removed all together. All of the code that was dependent on this functionality has been reverted to the standard means. ## Motivation and Context  Crash on exit.  ## How Has This Been Tested?  Ran it several time on Linux so far to make sure it doesn\\\'t crash. Since the crash was rare this isn\\\'t a foolproof means of testing. @FernetMenta was able to reproduce it relatively easily.   ## Screenshots (if appropriate):  ## Types of change  [x] Bug fix (non-breaking change which fixes an issue) [ ] Improvement (non-breaking change which improves existing functionality) [ ] New feature (non-breaking change which adds functionality) [ ] Breaking change (fix or feature that would cause existing functionality to change)  ## Checklist: [x] My code follows the [Code guidelines]url  of this project  [ ] My change requires a change to the documentation

column10: b"b' Add support for Raspberry Pi 3 (Cortex-A53) at build time (v18)'"

b"b' ## Description Support Raspberry Pi 3 (RPi3) with Cortex-A53 processor.  ## Motivation and Context Allow for the generation of hardware-specific optimized code through gcc supported hardware-specific flags.  This is no different in principal to what is currently shipping (ie RPi and RPi2 specific options).  ## How Has This Been Tested? Minimal testing on my part so far.  Builds and runs fine.  No regressions using Kodi to play different formatted video and audio files.  I did not conduct any controlled benchmarks

b"b' Thread priorities are wrong. I started kodi with nice -1. The only thread with prio is AESink that should get nice of -2. ActiveAE has nice -2 and no background priorities for thread like peripherials  ![image]url Should be: ![image]url  '"

column11: but the particular thread has the wrong priority (AESink
column12: not ActiveAE should have a non-default higher priority)? I\'m not sure I could have done that intentionally if I wanted to by changing things at the base level. :-)  What tool are you using to inspect LWP priorities and hierarchies?"'

column10: b'b" I am using htop  Not only AESink has wrong prio. Note that SetPriority may be called from other threads! That\'s why the current code has a lock that you removed. Unintentionally ofc :)"'
b'b" thread priorities higher then 0 (negative values) won\'t work on 99% of linux systems
column11: because those are not allowed by default
column12: so we should not use them. 0 is low enough."'

column10: b'b" Kodi\'s thread priorities are relative to the priority of the app. "'
b"b' my point is that trying to set a prio of -1 is not only going to fail
column11: in some cases (e.g. snap packages) this causes kodi to be killed by OS security layers. If you insist on using negative values
column12: this should be configurable. At least as a cmake option.'"

column10: b'b" we don\'t set anything that is going to fail.  EDIT: this code has been running for many years. please point me to a single case where anything related to thread priorities failed."'
b"b' We do
column11: under certain circumstances. As said above
column12: e.g. snap packages enforce strict security rules with appparmor and seccomp. Even using a forbidden syscall causes your app to be killed. And one such rule is that negative thread priorities are not allowed.'"

column10: b'b" I\'ll make sure it works the same way it used to. Thanks."'
b"b' the way it used to work is a problem. We should never try to set a negative prio(we currently do without this PR).'"
b'b" @wsnipex this is nonsense. we don\'t set higher prio than the system allows for a user."'
b'b" @FernetMenta you aren\'t listening and obviously are not familiar how seccomp works. If doesn\'t care about any / settings. If you still don\'t believe me
column11: configure a seccomp filter for kodi with the following rule
column12: which snap uses: >setpriority PRIO_PROCESS 0 <=19 "'

b"b' RetroPlayer: Merge savestate metadata into .sav file'"
b'b" ## Description  Introduced in url  RetroPlayer uses two files for autosave: a .sav file for the memory data
column11: and an .xml file for metadata. This combines both memory data and metadata into a single .sav file.  In this PR
column12: FlatBuffers is used to serialize metadata. This library was chosen for performance reasons
column13: as it is the only popular serialization library that allows for zero-copy. Although it requires a native compiler
column14: the target library is headers-only.  Backwards compatibility with XML files was not retained due to the extra code it would take
column15: and RetroPlayer is still alpha software.  As a result of this PR
column16: savestates are several hundred kb smaller
column17: half as many files
column18: and  should be faster on slow devices due to skipping costly XML operations.  I spent a LONG time on the build system stuff

b'b\'   ## Bug report ### Describe the bug Here is a clear and concise description of what the problem is:  The Diagnostics in  rarely include the return from eglGetError and when they do return an opaque numeric value.  GLContextEGL:~157 emits the exact same diagnostic as line 163  ## Expected Behavior Here is a clear and concise description of what was expected to happen: Debug output should include the egl error on failure  ## Actual Behavior  EGL errors do not show textual reasons why egl call fails. EGL Errors should clearly localise where the failure happens and the proper context  ## Possible Fix I added the below private method to class CGLContextEGL  Added method ====== std::string CGLContextEGL::GetEGLErrorString() {  int error= eglGetError();   switch(error)   {   case EGL_SUCCESS: return "No erro";   case EGL_NOT_INITIALIZED: return "EGL not initialized or failed to initialize";   case EGL_BAD_ACCESS: return "Resource inaccessible";   case EGL_BAD_ALLOC: return "Cannot allocate resources";   case EGL_BAD_ATTRIBUTE: return "Unrecognized attribute or attribute value";   case EGL_BAD_CONTEXT: return "Invalid EGL context";   case EGL_BAD_CONFIG: return "Invalid EGL frame buffer configuration";   case EGL_BAD_CURRENT_SURFACE: return "Current surface is no longer valid";   case EGL_BAD_DISPLAY: return "Invalid EGL display";   case EGL_BAD_SURFACE: return "Invalid surface";   case EGL_BAD_MATCH: return "Inconsistent arguments";   case EGL_BAD_PARAMETER: return "Invalid argument";   case EGL_BAD_NATIVE_PIXMAP: return "Invalid native pixmap";   case EGL_BAD_NATIVE_WINDOW: return "Invalid native window";   case EGL_CONTEXT_LOST: return "Context lost";   }   std::string s = std::to_string(error);   return "Unknown error "+s; } <========  Changed duplicate diagnostic message at GLContextEGL:~163 Note the addition of textual errors from GetEGLErrorString. All other EGL Errors should attach a similar error description.  CLog::Log(LOGERROR

column10: b'b" a few recommendations:  1) best practice is not to use line-breaks in your strings. the addon does not know the text width of the ok dialog
column11: so there\'s no guarantee the part before the line-break even fits on a single line. kodi will handle the insertion of line breaks
column12: depending on the text width of the dialog. worst case scenario
column13: kodi will insert a line break just a word before your harcoded line break.  2) your \'possible fix\' (passing three lines instead of one) is kind of deprecated and will potentially be removed in future kodi versions."'

column10: b"b' What ronie said is correct. You either use the multi line option or the separate lines one which is deprecated.'"
b'b" I\'m outputting data that needs to be line separated in specific locations
column11: it\'s not just a sentence. The multiline option does not work.  [This]url  is what it\'s meant to look like (using my wrapper which you say will break eventually) [This]url  is without my wrapper (using the multiline option) and with line breaks where the should be [This]url  is without my wrapper (using the multiline option) and without line breaks  The only conclusion I can come to is the kodi function is implemented incorrectly."'

column10: b"b' Fixed with [#14837]url '"
b"b' VobSub & PGS subtitles are stretching to fill output resolution instead of video resolution'"
b'b" ## Bug report Videos with graphics-based subtitles are stretched
column11: regardless of video aspect
column12: to fill the screen. (Discussed here: url ## Expected Behavior The subtitles shouldn\'t be stretched or distorted depending on the output resolution
column13: but rather the  resolution.  ## Actual Behavior For example
column14: any video with an aspect ratio wider than 16:9 playing on a standard 16:9 monitor
column15: Kodi stretches the subtitles vertically
column16: across the black bars in a distorted fashion. Subtitles also get stretched stretched horizontally if you play a 4:3 video on a 16:9 display.  ## Possible Fix Graphics based subtitles contain data pertaining to the output dimensions
column17: currently this is ignored. Even the video dimensions are ignored. All that needs to be done is to take these values and apply them when rendering the subtitles.  Aditionally
column18: as discussed in the thread above
column19: I thought it would be neat to have a setting in Player Settings Each caption in  subtitles have a positional value
column20: but they are almost always the same the bottom-centre of the screen. You could have a setting \'override graphical subtitle positioning\' which ignores positions the subtitles positions them according to the \'Subtitle position on screen\' value. Treating each image in the subtitles as an  caption  ### To Reproduce Steps to reproduce the behavior: 1. Play a video wider / taller than Kodi\'s output dimensional ratio with graphics based subtitles VobSub () or PGS (sup) 2. Observe the stretching.  ### Debuglog N/A  ### Screenshots  Here are some links or screenshots to help explain the problem:  The video I\'m using has dimensions of 1920x818
column21: as do the embedded VobSub subtitles
column22: display output is 1920x1080.  Wrong (Kodi):  ![czvlqsi]url Correct (VLC):  ![y49ay2c]url ## Additional context or screenshots (if appropriate) I have observed this on all versions of Kodi that I use
column23: including the ones mentioned below and an Amlogic build for Android TV boxes.  ### Your Environment Used Operating system:  [x] Android  [ ] iOS  [ ] Linux  [ ] OSX  [x] Raspberri-Pi  [x] Windows  [ ] Windows UWP Operating system : Windows 10  Kodi version: 17.6  "'

b'b" Since starting this a week ago I\'ve changed my mind on this issue. What I failed to mention originally was that the subtitle I used in the example was cropped using the aforementioned BDSup2Sub because I assumed the dimensions of the subtitles had to match the video
column11: otherwise the looked squished in VLC.  But after looking at other rips online
column12: I\'ve realised no one else does this
column13: they leave the subtitles untouched. If the video is sourced from a bluray the subtitles will always say it belongs to a 1920x1080 video
column14: even if the video has been cropped to remove the black bars. I couldn\'t find a single example whereby the ripper had adjusted graphics-based subtitles after cropping the video like I was doing. I looked at a couple versions of La Dolce Vita (which I got the original screenshots from) and they rendered perfectly in Kodi
column15: VLC on the other hand was _not_ so beautiful:  ![kgisivs]url ^ If you\'ve seen the film you\'ll know you cannot trust this man.  If you changed the default behaviour in Kodi to my preference
column16: you\'ll upset everyone else who gets their TV & Film from publicly available rips (ie
column17: from torrent sites). I think the way it currently works is correct and should remain the default way. I\'ve gone back and restored all of my ripped films\' subtitles and they render correctly now on Kodi
column18: but not in VLC. An option wouldn\'t be a bad idea
column19: but I suspect most users won\'t have a clue what its for or benefit from it."'

column10: b"b' Feature request: Unified games system
column11: savestates and savefiles directories'"

column10: b'b" ## Feature request ### Describe the bug  The directory is where the BIOS and other important files needed by the Game cores are placed. Currently each addon requires to put the BIOSse on a directory USER_. As discussed in [this]url  and subsequent posts with @garbear
column11: this is a design flaw because many BIOSes are shared among cores. With the current implementation this is not possible. The system directory is a property of the libretro frontend
column12: not of the cores.  Another problem is that the savestates are created next to each ROM. ROM directories must not be writable by the libretro frontend (that is
column13: Kodi).  ## Expected Behavior  A better implementation is to create the system
column14: savestates and savefiles directories in a special directory in USER_DATA. For example:   Kodi core is expected to create these directories and use them instead of the current directories.  ## Current Behavior  Explained in the bug description. The current implementation works
column15: however it complicates a lot the setup of emulators in Kodi Leia. The proposed implementation is based on Retroarch behaviour
column16: it\'s more efficient in terms of disk space and easy to set up.  ## Possible Fix  Explained in the Expected behaviour.  ### Your Environment Used Operating system: tested on Debian Linux amd64 architecture with a custom-built Kodi version cloning Github repository."'

column11: so Kodi has to ship it in its installation. We ship the dll from WinSDK. When WinSDK was updated on build server then the version of the dll changed also. I think that the new version has some dependencies which aren\'t available on Win7 without vc2017 redis."'

b"b' VTB: Video playback suffering of huge stuttering when playing 24hz movies'"

b'b\'   ## Bug report ### Describe the bug 24hz movies playback (with "_Adjust display refresh rate: Always_") is stuttering a lot when "_Allow Hardware Acceleration VTBDecoder_" is _ON_. The image is very jerky to the point of making it impossible to watch
column11: the sound is completely shifted.  If user set "_Allow Hardware Acceleration VTBDecoder_" to _OFF_ things goes a lot better (despite some small stuttering every 10/15 sec) but CPU usage is very High.  There are no visible issues when playing videos at 50hz and 60hz.   ## Expected Behavior The display should be set to 24hz (for 24hz movie) and the video playback must be completely fluid without shifting the sound and image. Like it was in Kodi v17.   ## Actual Behavior Display refresh rate is correctly set to 24hz (using this []url  _Hardware acceleration_ is **ON** and _Adjust refresh rate_ is **ALWAYS** but display is stuttering.  **Note**:  In Kodi v17 refresh rate change was sent to TV just one time. In v18
column12: the change rate is sent to TV three very fast consecutive times (less than 1 sec delay between each). ## Possible Fix No known workaround other than by ceasing to display movies in 24hz. Disabling Hardware Acceleration VTBDecoder is not really viable as it leads to very High CPU usage and tends to increase frame drop when CPU goes to 100%.  **Noteworthy point 1:** If an active ARD (Apple Remote Desktop) session is open and active to remote control the server that runs Kodi
column13: the stuttering almost disappear. **Noteworthy point 2:** A similar behavior found if user tries to Screen-capture (Cmd Shift 4 then space then left mouse button ) while Kodi is playing. When screen-capture is in fullscreen selection (using \\\'space\\\' shortcut) macOS turns the active screen to transparent blue. During this period (screen colored in blue
column14: screen capture not yet taken) the stuttering completely disappear (but the screen is "covered" with a transparent blue filter).  It looks like something is broken in hardware acceleration of VTBDecoder in Kodi v18. Those issues are not present in v17.  ### To Reproduce Steps to reproduce the behavior:   _This procedure requires that Kodi is connected to a TV set that supports 24p / 24hz frequency rates._  0. **macOS**: delete (or rename to keep a backup) -1. **Kodi**: Run Kodi once to let it create its default configuration in  . Then quit. 2. **macOS**: add custom refresh rates to []url  3. **Kodi**: Activate 1920x1080@24hz
column16: 1920x1080@60hz in the white list 4. **Kodi**: Set **Adjust display refresh rate** to **Always** 5. **Kodi**: Set **Allow Hardware Acceleration VTBDecoder** to **ON** 6. **Kodi**: Add a Movie source 7. **Kodi**: Choose to play a movie that has been encoded to display at 24hz (most BluRay I ripped are 24hz) 8. **Kodi**: Start to play movie 9. **Kodi**: Note that the TV is switched to 24hz resolution  10. **Kodi**: observe that movie playback is stuttering  ### Debuglog A debuglog can be found [here]url ### Screenshots  Player debug info (ctrl-shift-o):  ![]url Debug info with _Sync playback to display_: **ON** (also stuttering):  ![]url ## Additional context or screenshots (if appropriate) A thread about this issue is available [here]url ### Your Environment Used Operating system:  [X] macOS  [ ] Android  [ ] iOS  [ ] Linux  [ ] Raspberri-Pi  [ ] Windows  [ ] Windows UWP Operating system : tested on macOS 10.12.6

b'b" Hi there !  I see that 18.1 RC is out and unfortunately I see no sign of change regarding this issue. Should we consider that macOS is now an abandoned platform for Kodi ?  For the sake of clarity
column11: I am not asking this question with any kind of provocation.  I\'m not a developer and I can\'t help with the code
column12: only with the tests. However
column13: the problem described in this ticket is major and blocking and makes the use of Kodi 18 simply impossible. Workarounds to this problem degrade the user experience to such an extent that they cannot be considered a solution
column14: even temporarily. Kodi v17 still works very well and I would continue to use it. But we all know what happens to software that can no longer evolve.  Playing a video on a simple laptop does not require Kodi
column15: however
column16: I sincerely hope that a solution to this problem exists
column17: because Kodi v17 remains the best way to implement an advanced media center on macOS.  In any case
column18: you can count on me to test and support any attempt to do so."'

column10: b"b' I won\\xe2\\x80\\x98t consider the platform as abandoned just because not all hardware is behaving the same. I understand how frustrating it is to not getting a solution to this. I can\\xe2\\x80\\x98t realize a fix for this. So we either wait that a developer with affected hardware can dig into it or we have to wait until my real live gives more spare time to try some stuff out. The latter is some years away from now I guess.'"
b'b" I agree with that. I hope you have understood: the message was not specifically intended for you. Quite the contrary! Your contribution
column11: all these years
column12: is obviously a real boon for the mac user community.  The problem is not to support specific antediluvian hardware but to keep a certain consistency with recent hardware from one version of Kodi to another (an Apple computer is
column13: unfortunately
column14: often considered recent during many years! \\xf0\\x9f\\x98\\x84). Things that worked perfectly before
column15: suddenly stop working
column16: rendering the solution unusable. We are not talking here about a cosmetic problem with the graphical interface but about the most important functions of the solution: playing videos like not other solution is able to.  I\'m not saying it\'s easy and it needs to be fixed right away
column17: but v18 has been available for months
column18: 18.1 is coming
column19: v19 will eventually come soon but regression is still present without much visibility if it can
column20: one day
column21: be eliminated. A little frustrating
column22: yes
column23: but nothing really serious \\xf0\\x9f\\x98\\x84  We just always wish Kodi the best!"'

column10: b'b\' External subtitles not loaded when "Play next video automatically" enabled.\''

b'b\'   ## Bug report ### Describe the bug Here is a clear and concise description of what the problem is:  I\\\'ve created a media source for TV Shows pointing to a local file system folder (probably not relevant but
column11: just in case
column12: the information provider is set to "Local information only" as I use Ember Media Manager for collecting shows info). When playing the files through the Media Library node AND "Play next video automatically" is enabled for "Episodes"
column13: the external subtitles files are not displayed nor loaded (the list of available subtitles while playing the video is empy). The subtitle files are named appropriately though (using the same name as the video
column14: but with a language suffix and the subtitle type extension)
column15: and they are loaded and displayed properly when the same files are played through the media source node directly (instead of "TV Shows"
column16: use Videos The problem might be related to this other issue: url The following forum thread mentions the problem described (and also provides a work-around to the issue): url ## Expected Behavior Here is a clear and concise description of what was expected to happen: The external subtitles files should be loaded and displayed
column17: in the same way they are when files are played through through the files nodes or when play next episodes automatically is disabled.  ## Actual Behavior As stated above
column18: the external subtitles files are not loaded when playing the files through the Media Library node if "Play next video automatically" is enabled for "Episodes". ## Possible Fix This seems to be related to the different way Kodi addresses the files when playing through the Media Library node vs when playing through the Files node (see attached screenshots).  ### To Reproduce Steps to reproduce the behavior:  1. Create a TV Shows media source pointing to a local folder with shows containing external subtitle files. 2. Enable "Play next video automatically" for Episodes by going to Settings -3. Go to TV Shows and attempt to play an episode of one of the added shows. Subtitles will not be displayed
column19: attempting to browse the available subtitles won\\\'t show them either.  ### Debuglog The debuglog can be found here: []url ### Screenshots  Here are some links or screenshots to help explain the problem:  Browse subtitles
column20: when playing file through TV Shows node with play next episode automatically enabled. ![image]url  Browse subtitles
column21: when playing file through created media source node or through TV Shows node with play next episode automatically disabled. ![image]url (Notice the URL the subtitles are being searched on) ### Your Environment Used Operating system:  [ ] Android  [ ] iOS  [ ] Linux  [ ] OSX  [ ] Raspberri-Pi  [x] Windows  [ ] Windows UWP Operating system : Windows 10  Kodi version: Kodi 18 (Leia) RC1 *note: Once the issue is made we require you to update it with new information or Kodi versions should that be required. Team Kodi will consider your problem report however

column10: b"b' @pkerling we introduced dynPath because path is the id of a fileitem and must never be changed. In this case path points to the name if the item in videodb and dynPath is set to the actual file. GetDynPath returns dynPath
column11: if set. If there is no dynPath
column12: GetDynPath returns path. There have been several places where we missed to change GetPath to GetDynPath. This is one of them.'"

Portable mode is invoked by adding "-p" to the target of the Window shortcut used to inkoke Kodi. For investigating this issue (that is possibly related to your file access or files) I would start with a _clean_ test installation (install Kodi v18 RC4 in a separate folder and use portable mode) and run stand alone using SQLite (not client servrer using MariaDB). column10: b"b' I put the file here: url '"
b'b" Thanks @bartmans you can remove that link now
column11: I have grabbed the file for the team.  The issue is the tagging which is causing the version of Taglib used in Leia to read the tags to crash. It is Finding a UFID frame with junk in it. Kodi\'s use of Taglib needs to be more robust to avoid the crash
column12: and Taglib needs to handle this file better too (I will raise it with them).  The solution for you is to clear the tags and retag this file. Mp3tag shows in only having two tags (album and title)
column13: but I suspect a bit by bit analysis of the header will show something else."'

column10: b'b" I cleared the tags from the file and retagged it. Kodi doesn\'t crash anymore
column11: so my direct problem is solved."'

b"b' Music library performance problems in Leia RC3'"

b'b\'   ## Bug report ### Describe the bug Here is a clear and concise description of what the problem is:  The following big delays always happen in Leia RC3 and did not happen in v17.6 which I was running immediately before updating to Leia RC3.  4 5 seconds from selecting Music in the top level menu until the Music top level (Artists
column11: Albums
column12: etc.) is displayed. 4 5 seconds from pressing backspace to return to the Music top level from somewhere else before it is displayed. 30 seconds to create a party mode play list. 17.6 took less than a third of that time. 5 to 7 seconds to display the playlist: after it has been created
column13: when returning to it from the OSD (backspace) or when picking playlist from pull right options menu in top-level music. It is displayed immediately in 17.6.  During the delay showing the playlist a pop up message box appears titled "Scanning Media Information" and saying inside  I have never seen this message box in 17.x.  ## Expected Behavior Here is a clear and concise description of what was expected to happen: The top-level music menu should be displayed immediately. The playlist should be displayed immediately. Generating a party mode playlist should take less than 10 seconds.  ## Actual Behavior Displaying the top-level music menu takes 4 5 seconds. Displaying the current playlist takes 5 to 7 seconds Creating a party mode playlist takes 30 seconds.  ## Possible Fix  ### To Reproduce Steps to reproduce the behavior:  1. Start Kodi 2. In the top-level menu click Music. Observe the time taken for it to be displayed. 3. In the Music menu pick Party Mode in the pull right option menu.   Observe the Mixing Drinks pop-up displayed for 30 seconds following by 5 7 seconds of empty screen before the playlist is finally displayed. 4. Go full screen so the OSD is displayed. 5. Press backspace and observe the 5 7 seconds delay before the playlist is displayed. 6. Press backspace and observe the 4 -5 seconds delay before the Music top-level menu is displayed. 7. Repeat ad nauseum.  ### Debuglog The debuglog can be found here:  url I did the above steps several times while this log was being captured.  ## Additional context or screenshots (if appropriate) Here is some additional context or explanation that might help: There is also a huge delay the first time you visit the Add-Ons node in the main menu. However unlike the problems I\\\'m reporting with the Music node
column14: this does not repeat.  ### Your Environment Used Operating system:  [ ] Android  [ ] iOS  [ ] Linux  [x] OSX  [ ] Raspberri-Pi  [ ] Windows  [ ] Windows UWP Operating system : 10.14.2 / macOS Mojave  Kodi version: Leia 18.0 RC3   *note: Once the issue is made we require you to update it with new information or Kodi versions should that be required. Team Kodi will consider your problem report however

column10: b'b" Thanks. Such a modest library in the scheme of things
column11: so sorry about the slowness.  With help from @MilhouseVH I now understand _why_ the start up of party mode is so slow on MySQL. There is a general MySQL optimizer limitation when using aggregate functions within subqueries as colums in a view. See url  and url  . Along with not using indices on correlated subqueries
column12: this is yet another example of what a poor RDBMS MySQL is
column13: and why users should be surprized by poor performance. Since Jarvis url  the artist datadded has been derived from the songs (rather than be stored directly in the artist table)
column14: and  has included a subquery as a column expression.  As a result even to fetch a single row from MySQL scans the entire artist table first. At the start of party mode the artistview is queried separately for each artist of the first 10 songs This is what is taking >1s per song. For comparison on SQLite it takes a mere1ms
column15: yes 1000 times faster and MySQL will be even slower depending on how many artists are in the db.  This general weakness of the MySQL optimiser will be effecting many queries involving albums or artists (views of both have subqueries as columns)
column16: but the slowness is particularly noticeable in party mode which is unique in fetching rows one at a time. Elsewhere e.g. songs or artists nodes
column17: many rows are being fetched and so the full table scans that happen are less noticeable. This is ironic as party mode was created as a quick alternative to showing the songs node on large libraries (which is slow for other reasons not the db).  I will look at a fix of party mode to avoid this MySQL issue
column18: if I can achieve an improvement without changes to the schema. But since it has been happening since Jarvis
column19: and I don\'t know anyone else has noticed or complained
column20: I don\'t think there is the need to rush into anything risky at the stage in the release cycle of v18.  I intend to review the use of in the music library for v19 anyway
column21: I will certainly keep this issue in mind when I do. If we really want to take efficiency on MySQL db seriously (and fight the pathetic optimiser) without compromising the mainstream SQLite implementation
column22: then there are many areas that can be visited. How far I will be able to get alone that road I don\'t know
column23: but undertsanding the issue is a good first step. "'

column12: you may have to change other things for them to continue to work too.  Why open is slower when is enabled does seem specific to your config of server and network
column13: we have not been able to reproduce anything like it. With that option enabled Kodi announces a new service over Zeroconf to expose port 9090. When anything connects to  it does a reverse dns  zeroconf search on the IP to try to get the name so that it can identify users associated with the host. It seems that having extra Zeroconf announcements is upsetting MySQL. All things happens outside of Kodi.  You could try disabling Zeroconf from within Kodi
column14: that could prove the above. '"

column10: b"b' I am pretty sure that the remaining v18 slowness you are experiencing is on the MariaDB side of things when creating a connection
column11: not internal to Kodi. If it takes more than 1s to get a connection
column12: something Kodi does multiple times
column13: then many things are going to be slow.  Server caching could be contributing
column14: and the  of **skip-name-resolve** cleared the cache which was allowing v18 to be faster sometimes (e.g. when disabled)
column15: but has not refilled. Why has this shown up on v18? Well since alpha 1 Kodi uses MariaDB Connector 3.0.3 client library to connect to MariaDB and MySQL databases
column16: replacing the MySQL 5.1.55 client libraries previously used. The combination of that with your 5.5.59 MariaDB on OSX and network setup could be making lookup slow to resolve addresses. @MarkCallow  it could just come down to needing to update to MariaDB 10.3 but I can not be sure that will solve it. Other users are using v18 with 5.5  without these connection delays
column17: so it is not just a simple matter of connector compatibilty. What settings do you have for MariaDB
column18: any file? Or running as default config?  You could you try disabling Zeroconf from within Kodi. Kodi announcing over zeroconf could be triggering difficulties in MariaDB ability to resolve addresses over zeroconf.  The other thing to try is using actual IP address as  in  rather than  I still think setting skip-name-resolve and using IP addresses everywhere rather than zeroconf lookup will help. Slowness to connect with MySQL seems almost always related to resolving addresses. It has helped other users where Kodi access to db on NAS suddenly went slow url   '"

Sorry I have no personal experience of running MariaDB on a NAS dive so the guidence I can give is limited. I believe Synology has integrated docker support so I suppose the different MariaDB server versions you say are installed are in containers that are either listening on different IPs or different external ports.  You will have to pursue that yourself I\'m afraid.  All the Kodi guides on using  say to use IP address of the server in  e.g.
column16: and I recommend that you do that rather than the shortcut .  Assign your NAS a fixed IP address and use that. Use of IP addresses avoids resolving names and is known to be quicker. This should be accompanied by adding to the  file
column17: again as recommended.  Some notes here url  url  url Looking at other settings in   could be bigger if you have the memory. MariaDB recommend 80% of available in multiples of 1G. I will see if anyone else on the team has any other suggestions.  If you are thinking but it works for v17 and if it doesn\'t for v18 then that is a Kodi problem all I can remind you is that  server use for Kodi is an experiemental feature.  There are just too many server versions on too many platforms

b'b\'   ## Bug report ### Describe the bug Kodi reads some languages codes wrong if they are in this way "pt-BR" (Brazilian Portuguese) and "es-ES" (European Spanish)
column11: it reads "pt-BR" as "Portuguese Breton" and reads "es-ES" as "Spanish Spanish"
column12: it reads the abbreviation "BR" as the language "Breton" when it should read it as the country "Brazil" and reads "ES" as "Spanish" instead of the country "Spain"
column13: and this leads to choosing the wrong language for the audio and subtitles (usually chooses the default language)
